original: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid ming du chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid ming du chags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the designation of dependent origination.

original: rkyen du zhig gis ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen du zhig gis ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What conditions are the conditions for ignorance?

original: gzugs can rnams la ni bdag po'i rkyen gyis rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams la ni bdag po'i rkyen gyis rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: For those that are material, the dominant condition is the condition.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni /
translated: For those that are not material,

original: de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gsum kho nas rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gsum kho nas rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: the three conditions are the antecedent condition, the object condition, and the dominant condition.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams la ni ci rigs par rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams la ni ci rigs par rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The remaining members should be understood as conditions in the appropriate manner.

original: gzugs can rnams ni gzugs can rnams la bdag po'i rkyen gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni gzugs can rnams la bdag po'i rkyen gcig gis so //
translated: For those that are material, the dominant condition is the single condition.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni /
translated: For those that are not material,

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang gnyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang gnyis so //
translated: the object condition and the dominant condition are the two conditions.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni gzugs can rnams la gcig pu kho nas so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni gzugs can rnams la gcig pu kho nas so //
translated: For those that are material, the single condition is the dominant condition.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni /
translated: For those that are not material,🔽the object condition is the single condition.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la /
translated: Those that are not physical are the four mental aggregates.🔽

original: de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gsum gyis so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gsum gyis so //
translated: The other conditions are the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: ci'i phyir yan lag 'di dag rgyu'i rkyen gyis rkyen du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yan lag 'di dag rgyu'i rkyen gyis rkyen du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are these conditions not included in the causal condition?

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni rang gi sa bon gyi rkyen gyis phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni rang gi sa bon gyi rkyen gyis phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The causal condition is included in the seed condition.

original: gal te rgyu'i rkyen gyis rkyen rnams su mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i rkyen gyis rkyen rnams su mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the causal condition is not included in the conditions,

original: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du bstan zhe na /
translated: why is dependent origination taught in terms of cause and effect?

original: bdag po'i rkyen gyis bsdus pa'i 'dren pa'i rgyu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen gyis bsdus pa'i 'dren pa'i rgyu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in terms of the dominant condition that the leading cause, the projecting cause, and the actualizing cause are included.

original: yan lag rnams las su zhig 'phen po'i rgyur bsdus she na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las su zhig 'phen po'i rgyur bsdus she na /
translated: Which members are included in the projecting cause?

original: ma rig pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From ignorance up to

original: tshor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: feeling.

original: yan lag rnams las du zhig mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur bsdus she na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du zhig mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur bsdus she na /
translated: Which members are included in the actualizing cause?

original: sred pa nas bzung ste /🔽sred pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sred pa nas bzung ste / sred pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From craving up to🔽and including feeling, there are seven members that are results of the projecting cause.🔽From birth up to and including aging and death, there are four members that are results of the actualizing cause.

original: yan lag rnams las du zhig 'phen pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bur bsdus she na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du zhig 'phen pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bur bsdus she na /
translated: From among the members, how many are causes that project and how many are causes that actualize?🔽From this life up to the consciousness of the next life, there are seven members that are causes that project.

original: tshe 'di nas tshe phyi ma'i rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba la thug pa rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga shi'i gnas skabs rnams so //
analyzed: tshe 'di nas tshe phyi ma'i rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba la thug pa rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga shi'i gnas skabs rnams so //
translated: From birth up to and including feeling, there are four members that are causes that actualize.

original: ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes kyang gsungs na /🔽rten cing 'brel par @111a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes kyang gsungs na / rten cing 'brel par @111a * //
translated: Since it is said that ignorance arises from the cause of improper mental attention,

original: 'byung ba bshad pa'i skabs su ci'i phyir de thog mar ma bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'byung ba bshad pa'i skabs su ci'i phyir de thog mar ma bstan ce na /
translated: why is it not taught as the first member in the context of dependent origination?

original: spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /🔽'di ltar yid la byed pa de ni /
analyzed: spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir / 'di ltar yid la byed pa de ni /
translated: It is not taught as the first member because it is not the cause of elimination and it is not the cause of affliction.

original: rmongs pa ma yin pa la mi skye la /
analyzed: rmongs pa ma yin pa la mi skye la /
translated: In this way, mental attention does not arise in those who are not confused.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / ma rig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / ma rig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni /
translated: Dependent origination is the cause of the afflictions, and ignorance is naturally afflicted.🔽Incorrect attention is not naturally afflicted.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / des ni ma rig pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / des ni ma rig pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed kyi /
translated: It does not afflict ignorance,🔽but it becomes afflicted due to the power of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba yang las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba yang las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yin la /
translated: Birth is generated by karma and affliction.

original: de la las kyi rgyun ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la las kyi rgyun ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The continuum of karma is the first link of dependent origination, ignorance.

original: de'i phyir yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, incorrect attention is not mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen du ngo bo nyid ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen du ngo bo nyid ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is the intrinsic reality of the condition not mentioned?

original: ngo bo nyid ni rkyen gzhan dang ma phrad na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rkyen gzhan dang ma phrad na /
translated: Intrinsic reality does not arise from other conditions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gso bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gso bar byed pa'am /
translated: It heals the nature of the afflictions.🔽

original: nyams par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the dependent nature is healed or damaged by the mode of the thoroughly afflictive.

original: de bas na ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not taught.

original: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ni /
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ni /
translated: As for the meritorious and imperturbable formative forces,

original: so sor brtags nas bsgrims te byas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas bsgrims te byas pa ma yin na /
translated: if they are not produced by being tightly bound by analysis,

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: why are they called “arisen from the condition of ignorance”?

original: brdar btags pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi shes pa la /
analyzed: brdar btags pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi shes pa la /
translated: In regard to the cause of suffering that is designated by convention,

original: de'i rkyen gyis bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung la /
translated: the nonmeritorious [formative forces] arise due to the condition of not knowing that.

original: yang dag pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi shes pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi shes pa la /
translated: In regard to the cause of true suffering,

original: de'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams 'byung ste /
translated: the meritorious and imperturbable [formative forces] arise due to the condition of not knowing that.

original: de bas na de dag kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those [formative forces] are also called “arisen from the condition of ignorance.”

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang las kyi gzhir gsungs na /
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang las kyi gzhir gsungs na /
translated: If attachment, aversion, and delusion are said to be the basis of karma,

original: ci'i phyir gti mug bzhi kho na zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gti mug bzhi kho na zhes bya zhe na /
translated: why are only the four delusions mentioned?

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gzhi'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gzhi'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the context is the basis of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and non-agitated action.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni bsod nams ma yin pa kho na'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni bsod nams ma yin pa kho na'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Greed, hatred, and delusion are the basis of non-meritorious action alone.

original: sems pa ni lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar byed pas /
analyzed: sems pa ni lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar byed pas /
translated: Intention is the instigator of bodily and vocal action.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Since formations are the condition of formations,

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: why is ignorance alone stated as the condition?

original: 'du byed mtha' dag kun @111b slong ba'i rkyen gyi skabs yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i sems pa bskyed pa'i rkyen gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed mtha' dag kun @111b slong ba'i rkyen gyi skabs yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i sems pa bskyed pa'i rkyen gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the context is the condition of the instigator of all formations, and because it is the context of the condition that generates afflicted and virtuous intention.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na /
translated: Consciousness is also the result of the condition of name-and-form,

original: ci'i phyir don de la 'du byed rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don de la 'du byed rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: why is that meaning stated as the condition of formations alone?

original: 'du byed rnams ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byed pa dang / yang srid par 'phen par byed pa dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs ni rten pa dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'i rkyen byed pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byed pa dang / yang srid par 'phen par byed pa dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs ni rten pa dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'i rkyen byed pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
translated: Name-and-form is merely the condition that generates the support and the object.

original: ming dang gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / reg pa rgyur byas pa yin na /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / reg pa rgyur byas pa yin na /
translated: Name-and-form is derived from the great elements and contact.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: Why is consciousness alone said to be the condition?

original: rnam par shes pa ni de gsar du bskyed pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de gsar du bskyed pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Consciousness is the cause of generating that name-and-form anew.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / rig pa ni skyes zin pa dang / skye ba'i tshe gnas kyi rgyu 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / rig pa ni skyes zin pa dang / skye ba'i tshe gnas kyi rgyu 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements and contact are merely the cause of the support and the cause of the generation of that which has already arisen.

original: khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du 'chags pa yin na /
analyzed: khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du 'chags pa yin na /
translated: If it is generated in the mother’s womb in dependence on the six elements,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: why is it said to be the element of consciousness alone?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams yod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams yod na /
translated: If the consciousness element exists,

original: ma'i mngal du khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba chen po dang / mngal gyi sbubs ma tshang ba med pas /
analyzed: ma'i mngal du khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba chen po dang / mngal gyi sbubs ma tshang ba med pas /
translated: then the great elements of semen and blood in the mother’s womb and the womb itself are complete.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams gtso bor nges pa dang / skye gnas dang / srid pa thams cad du skye ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams gtso bor nges pa dang / skye gnas dang / srid pa thams cad du skye ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness element is the primary factor in this, and it is the occasion for birth in all birth processes and existences.

original: skye mched drug ni zas kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni zas kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na /
translated: The six sense spheres arise with food as a condition.

original: ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: Why is name-and-form alone said to be the condition of the six sense spheres?

original: ming dang gzugs ni de skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Name-and-form is the cause for their arising.

original: zas ni skyes nas gnas pa dang / ston pa'i rgyu tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas ni skyes nas gnas pa dang / ston pa'i rgyu tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Food is merely the cause for their abiding and development after they have arisen.

original: reg pa ni gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: reg pa ni gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin na /
translated: Contact arises with the three—sense faculty, object, and consciousness—as its condition.

original: ci'i phyir 'di skye mched drug rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skye mched drug rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that the six sense spheres are its condition?

original: skye mched drug yod na /
analyzed: skye mched drug yod na /
translated: If the six sense spheres exist,

original: de las gzhan pa gnyis nges par tshang bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gnyis nges par tshang bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then the other two are definitely complete.

original: skye mched drug gtso bo yin pa dang / skye mched drug gis gnyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gtso bo yin pa dang / skye mched drug gis gnyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six sense spheres are the principal factor, and because the six sense spheres include the other two.

original: tshor ba rnams ni bdag nyid kyis brtsal ba dang / pha rol gyis brtsal ba dang / dus tshigs 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi las kyis drangs pa dag las dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams ni bdag nyid kyis brtsal ba dang / pha rol gyis brtsal ba dang / dus tshigs 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi las kyis drangs pa dag las dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: Since feelings are observed to arise from one’s own efforts, from the efforts of others, from the change of seasons, and from previous karma,

original: ci'i phyir 'dir reg pa rkyen kho nar bstan zhe na /🔽reg pa @112a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir reg pa rkyen kho nar bstan zhe na / reg pa @112a * //
translated: why is contact alone taught to be the condition of feelings?

original: ni kun nas nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams 'dren pa yang reg pa yin pa dang / tshor ba de dag kyang reg pa las byung gi reg pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni kun nas nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams 'dren pa yang reg pa yin pa dang / tshor ba de dag kyang reg pa las byung gi reg pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Contact is the cause of the convergence of all the conditions of feeling. Contact is the condition that brings together the other conditions. Feelings arise from contact and do not occur without contact.

original: sred pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen dang / de dang mthun pa'i yul gyi rkyen las 'byung bar yang gsungs na /
analyzed: sred pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen dang / de dang mthun pa'i yul gyi rkyen las 'byung bar yang gsungs na /
translated: It is also said that craving arises from the condition of ignorance and from the condition of an object that is compatible with it.

original: ci'i phyir / 'dir tshor ba rnams rkyen kho nar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'dir tshor ba rnams rkyen kho nar bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it that only feeling is taught to be the condition of craving?

original: 'di ltar tshor ba'i dbang gis yul dang phrad cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba'i dbang gis yul dang phrad cing /
translated: Thus, due to the power of feeling, one desires to meet with and not be separated from an object.

original: mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i yul la ni gti mug 'ba' zhig gi dbang gis tshor ba de dag 'byung ba dang / nub par 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes nas /
analyzed: mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i yul la ni gti mug 'ba' zhig gi dbang gis tshor ba de dag 'byung ba dang / nub par 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes nas /
translated: And, due to the power of ignorance alone, one does not understand as it really is the arising and cessation of those feelings in relation to an object that accords with them.

original: de la sems zlog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sems zlog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one does not turn away from that.

original: len pa ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i chos rnams las kyang 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: len pa ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i chos rnams las kyang 'byung ba yin na /
translated: Since appropriation arises from the non-abandonment of latent states and from dharmas that accord with them,

original: ci'i phyir 'dir sred pa'i rkyen kho nas len pa zhes brjod ce na /🔽'di ltar 'dod pa skyes nas tshol bar byed pa na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir sred pa'i rkyen kho nas len pa zhes brjod ce na / 'di ltar 'dod pa skyes nas tshol bar byed pa na /
translated: why is it said here that appropriation is conditioned by craving alone?🔽Thus, when desire arises, one seeks out an object.

original: bag la nyal yang sad par byed la /
analyzed: bag la nyal yang sad par byed la /
translated: In this way, latent states are activated and

original: de dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: dharmas that accord with them are brought forth.

original: sngar ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las kyi srid pa zhes bshad na /
analyzed: sngar ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las kyi srid pa zhes bshad na /
translated: Previously, it was explained that the condition of ignorance is the existence of karma.

original: ci'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it said that existence is conditioned by grasping?

original: 'di ltar len pa'i stobs kyis las de nyid la skye ba'i gnas de dang der rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dren pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar len pa'i stobs kyis las de nyid la skye ba'i gnas de dang der rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dren pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by the power of grasping, karma has the power to lead consciousness and name-and-form to that and that place of rebirth.

original: skye ba ni khu chu dang / khrag la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: skye ba ni khu chu dang / khrag la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis kyang 'byung na /
translated: Birth occurs through the conditions of semen, blood, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir srid pa can kho nar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir srid pa can kho nar bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it said here that it is conditioned by existence?

original: srid pa yod na de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams tshang bar nges par yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa yod na de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams tshang bar nges par yod par 'gyur te /
translated: When there is existence, the other conditions are definitely complete.

original: de nyid rkyen gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence is the principal condition.

original: rga shi ni dus dang ya nga ba ma spangs pa dang / pha rol gyi gnod pa la sogs pa dag las kyang dmigs na /
analyzed: rga shi ni dus dang ya nga ba ma spangs pa dang / pha rol gyi gnod pa la sogs pa dag las kyang dmigs na /
translated: Aging and death are observed in the absence of time, misfortune, and harm from others.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir skye ba rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir skye ba rkyen kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said here that birth is a condition?

original: rkyen de dag gi rtsa ba yang skye ba yin la /
analyzed: rkyen de dag gi rtsa ba yang skye ba yin la /
translated: Birth is the root of those conditions.

original: rkyen de dag med du zin kyang rga shi ni skye ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen de dag med du zin kyang rga shi ni skye ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if these conditions are absent, aging and death occur due to birth.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag las /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag las /
translated: Among these twelve members,

original: yan lag du zhig ni nyon mongs pa'i lam yin /
analyzed: yan lag du zhig ni nyon mongs pa'i lam yin /
translated: how many are of the nature of afflictions?

original: du zhig ni las kyi lam yin /
analyzed: du zhig ni las kyi lam yin /
translated: How many are of the nature of actions?

original: du zhig ni sdug bsngal gyi lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni sdug bsngal gyi lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many are of the nature of suffering?

original: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i lam @112b mo ;
analyzed: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i lam @112b mo ;
translated: Three are of the nature of afflictions.

original: / gnyis ni las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: / gnyis ni las kyi lam mo //
translated: Two are of the nature of actions.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam mo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam mo //
translated: The rest are of the nature of suffering.

original: rgyur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are only causes?

original: dang po gcig go //
analyzed: dang po gcig go //
translated: The first is only a cause.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are only effects?

original: tha ma gcig go //
analyzed: tha ma gcig go //
translated: The last is only an effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa kho na dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are both causes and effects?

original: lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The rest are both causes and effects.

original: dri ba 'di'i lan gdab pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang /
analyzed: dri ba 'di'i lan gdab pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang /
translated: Another way of answering this question is as follows:

original: gsum ni rgyur gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gsum ni rgyur gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Three are only causes.

original: gnyis ni 'bras bur gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'bras bur gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Two are only effects.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur par blta bar bya'o //🔽so so'i mtshan nyid dag ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur par blta bar bya'o // so so'i mtshan nyid dag ni du /
translated: The other members should be understood as causes and effects.🔽How many members are characterized as specific?

original: 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are characterized as general?

original: gsum ni so so'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsum ni so so'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Three members are characterized as specific.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa gzhan rnams ni 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa gzhan rnams ni 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other members are characterized as general.

original: 'du byed rnams dang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the members are characterized as general,

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su bstan zhe na /
translated: why are they taught as two?

original: sdug pa de mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa dang / 'gro bar 'grub pa'i mthu'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: sdug pa de mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa dang / 'gro bar 'grub pa'i mthu'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Because of the difference in the power of the production of the effect of the agreeable and the disagreeable, and of the power of the accomplishment of the course.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug gi phyogs gcig kyang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug gi phyogs gcig kyang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the members of consciousness, name-and-form, and six sense bases are characterized as general,

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa gsum du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa gsum du bstan zhe na /
translated: why are they taught as three?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa dang / ldugs pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa dang / 'jug pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa dang / ldugs pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa dang / 'jug pa'i dus kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is the occasion of the world’s being engaged.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas tshor ba la thug pa dag dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas tshor ba la thug pa dag dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If consciousness, etc., up to feeling, and birth, old-age and death, are characterized by being mixed,

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su bstan zhe na /
translated: why are they taught in two parts?

original: sdug bsngal ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'phen pa dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rab tu dbye ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'phen pa dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rab tu dbye ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the different characteristics of the things that are suffering, and in order to teach the distinction between that which projects and that which actualizes.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'jig pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the destruction of dependent origination?

original: skyes pa rnams mi gnas pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams mi gnas pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the meaning of the non-abiding of what has arisen.

original: ldan pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of possession?

original: rkyen rnams tshogs shing phrad ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams tshogs shing phrad ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the meaning of the coming together and meeting of conditions.

original: skye ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of birth?

original: rkyen tshogs pas yongs su zin pa rnams sar pa sar pa 'byung ba'i don gang yin pa'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang /
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pas yongs su zin pa rnams sar pa sar pa 'byung ba'i don gang yin pa'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang /
translated: The meaning of the word pratītyasamutpāda is that which arises in dependence on a collection of conditions.🔽What is dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ni gang zhe na /🔽'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par @113a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ni gang zhe na / 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par @113a * //
translated: What is the nature of dependent origination?🔽The nature of arising of the formations is dependent origination.

original: 'byung ba'o // skyes pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'o // skyes pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The arising itself is called the nature of dependent origination.

original: yan lag rnams las du zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus la /
translated: How many members are included in the truth of suffering?

original: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Which are the members that are suffering in this life?

original: gnyis te skye ba dang rga sha' //
analyzed: gnyis te skye ba dang rga sha' //
translated: Two are suffering in this life: birth and old-age-and-death.

original: du ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: du ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid yin la /
translated: How many members are included in the truth of suffering, but are not suffering in this life?

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Which are the members that are suffering in the future?

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba la thug pa sa bon du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba la thug pa sa bon du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The members from consciousness up to feeling, which are the seeds of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is included in the truth of origination?

original: lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The rest.

original: ci ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung bas rkyen du 'gyur ram /🔽'on te 'gags ma thag pa rkyen du 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung bas rkyen du 'gyur ram / 'on te 'gags ma thag pa rkyen du 'gyur la /
translated: Is ignorance a condition of the formations by co-existence?🔽Or is it a condition by immediate succession?

original: 'on te 'gags nas ring du lon pa rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gags nas ring du lon pa rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or is it a condition by distant succession?

original: rnam pa gsum char gyis kyang rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /🔽lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char gyis kyang rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste / lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
translated: It should be understood that it is a condition in all three ways.

original: 'du byed dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sgrib pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sgrib pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Co-existence is a condition for the formations that are favorable to it.

original: gang gi don du 'du byed rnams slong bar byed pa de mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'du byed rnams slong bar byed pa de mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance of the purpose for which the formations are instigated.

original: 'gags ma thag pa ni rkyen to //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa ni rkyen to //
translated: Immediate succession is a condition.

original: lta ba ngan pa dang / bag med par ldan pa'i mi shes pas /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa dang / bag med par ldan pa'i mi shes pas /
translated: By means of the ignorance that is associated with bad views and heedlessness,

original: phyi ma la de skye ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud 'jog pas na /
analyzed: phyi ma la de skye ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud 'jog pas na /
translated: the stream is placed in a state favorable to the arising of the latter.

original: 'gags nas ring du long pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du long pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that even after a long time has passed, it is a condition by projecting.

original: 'du byed rnams rnam par shes pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na /🔽sa bon gyi tshul du yongs su bsgo bas na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnam par shes pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na / sa bon gyi tshul du yongs su bsgo bas na /
translated: How should the formations be viewed as the three conditions of consciousness?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //🔽de'i 'og tu dbang byed pas na /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // de'i 'og tu dbang byed pas na /
translated: They are the co-originating condition because they are the seed.

original: 'gags ma thag pa ni skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //🔽phyi ma la 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par 'phel bas na /
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa ni skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // phyi ma la 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par 'phel bas na /
translated: They are the immediately preceding condition because they are the immediately antecedent cause.

original: 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: They are the projecting condition because they project the result in the future.

original: ji ltar 'du byed rnams rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed rnams rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the formations are the condition of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang / ming dang gzugs skye mched drug gi rkyen dang / skye mched drug reg pa'i rkyen dang / reg pa tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang / ming dang gzugs skye mched drug gi rkyen dang / skye mched drug reg pa'i rkyen dang / reg pa tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: so also consciousness is the condition of name-and-form, name-and-form is the condition of the six sense bases, the six sense bases are the condition of contact, and contact is the condition of feeling.

original: tshor ba srid pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba srid pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should feeling be viewed as the three kinds of conditions of craving?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
translated: The co-originating condition is

original: lhag par zhen pa'i rkyen gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa'i rkyen gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the condition of strong attachment is the condition of seeing.

original: de ma thag pa ni de'i dbang gis yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rjes su 'jug pas @113b na skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni de'i dbang gis yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rjes su 'jug pas @113b na skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the condition of giving rise to the subsequent activities of seeking, etc.

original: phyi ma la de las grol bar dka' ba'i rgyud 'jog par byed pas na /
analyzed: phyi ma la de las grol bar dka' ba'i rgyud 'jog par byed pas na /
translated: The condition of projecting is the condition of projecting the future continuum, which is difficult to free from that.

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though a long time has passed since the cessation of the projecting cause, it is still the projecting condition.

original: sred pa len pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa len pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is craving the condition of grasping?

original: 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i phyir des blang bar bya ba'i chos rnams la 'dod cing zhen pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i phyir des blang bar bya ba'i chos rnams la 'dod cing zhen pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na /
translated: Craving is the condition of grasping because it is the condition of desire and attachment for the phenomena to be grasped, since it is associated with desire and attachment.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //🔽de ma thag pa ni de dbang byed pas na /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // de ma thag pa ni de dbang byed pas na /
translated: Thus it is the co-arising condition.

original: skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the condition of giving rise to grasping, since it is the dominant condition.

original: de las grol bar dka' ba'i rgyud 'jog par byed pas na /
analyzed: de las grol bar dka' ba'i rgyud 'jog par byed pas na /
translated: The condition of projecting is the condition of projecting the future continuum, which is difficult to free from that.

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the past action that has long ceased is the condition of projecting.

original: len pa srid pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: len pa srid pa'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is grasping a condition for the three kinds of existence?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni /
translated: The simultaneous condition is

original: las de'i 'gro ba sgrub par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: las de'i 'gro ba sgrub par 'gyur bas na /
translated: because the action establishes the destiny.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The condition of immediate antecedent is🔽because the power of that grasping leads to the consciousness of the place of rebirth.

original: de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i gnas de'i rnam par shes pa de la sogs pa 'dren pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na /🔽'gags ma thag pa skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //🔽khams 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mthu yod pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i gnas de'i rnam par shes pa de la sogs pa 'dren pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na / 'gags ma thag pa skyed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // khams 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mthu yod pa'i rkyen du gyur pas na /
translated: The projecting condition is

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: because the past action that has long ceased is the condition of projecting.

original: srid pa skye ba'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa skye ba'i rkyen rnam pa gsum gyis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is existence a condition for birth?🔽The simultaneous condition is

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen ni sa bon gyi tshul gyis yongs su bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen ni sa bon gyi tshul gyis yongs su bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seeds are perfumed.

original: de ma thag pa ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni /
translated: The condition of immediate antecedent is🔽because the existence that has just ceased is the cause of birth.

original: de'i dbang gis 'jug pas skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'jug pas skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the condition for birth.

original: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'bras bu de mngon par 'grub pa 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas ring du lon pa yang 'bras bu de mngon par 'grub pa 'phen pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when it has long ceased, it is the condition for the actualization of the effect.

original: ji ltar srid pa skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa ltar skye ba rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa ltar skye ba rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is the condition for the arising of existence, so it should be understood that birth is the condition for old age and death.

original: srid pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Existence is established in two ways:

original: gtso bo'i yan lag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i yan lag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The primary factor is as follows:

original: len pa yongs su zin pa'i las de sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: len pa yongs su zin pa'i las de sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The karma that is appropriated is as previously explained.

original: mtha' dag gi yan lag ni /
analyzed: mtha' dag gi yan lag ni /
translated: The complete factor is as follows:

original: las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa sa bon du gyur pa /
analyzed: las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa sa bon du gyur pa /
translated: Karma, consciousness, etc., up to feeling, which are seeds,

original: len pas yongs su zin pa rnams srid par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: len pas yongs su zin pa rnams srid par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: are appropriated and should be seen as the establishment of existence.

original: ci srid pa'i yan lag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci srid pa'i yan lag 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the factor of existence?

original: 'du byed nas rga shi la thug pa 'di dag gi las rim gyis rkyen du 'gyur ba de kho nar zad dam /🔽'on te gzhan @114a * //
analyzed: 'du byed nas rga shi la thug pa 'di dag gi las rim gyis rkyen du 'gyur ba de kho nar zad dam / 'on te gzhan @114a * //
translated: Is the order of the members from volitional action up to old age and death only a causal order?

original: 'ga' yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Or is there another order?

original: 'di ltar thams cad kyi las gnyis pa ni rang gi spyod yul ci rigs par 'jug pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad kyi las gnyis pa ni rang gi spyod yul ci rigs par 'jug pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the function of all the members should be seen as twofold: each member is the cause of the next member, and each member is the condition of the next member.

original: ci ma rig pa 'du byed rnams 'ba' zhig gi rkyen yin nam /
analyzed: ci ma rig pa 'du byed rnams 'ba' zhig gi rkyen yin nam /
translated: Is ignorance only the condition of volitional action?

original: 'on te yan lag gzhan dag gi yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag gzhan dag gi yang yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it also the condition of the other members?

original: ma rig pa ni rga shi yan chad kyi rkyen yang yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rga shi yan chad kyi rkyen yang yin te /
translated: Ignorance is also the condition of the other members up to old age and death.

original: rkyen rab tu nye ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: rkyen rab tu nye ba'i phyir na /
translated: But because the condition is very close,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kho nar bstan to //
translated: it is taught as the condition of volitional action alone.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The remaining members should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: yan lag 'og ma rnams ni gong ma gong ma rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag 'og ma rnams ni gong ma gong ma rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The lower members are not the conditions of the higher members.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci nas 'og ma spang ba'i phyir gong ma spang ba la sgrim par byed de /
analyzed: ci nas 'og ma spang ba'i phyir gong ma spang ba la sgrim par byed de /
translated: One should strive to abandon the higher realms in order to abandon the lower realms.

original: de spangs pas 'og ma spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de spangs pas 'og ma spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: By abandoning the higher realms, one abandons the lower realms.

original: gong ma spang ba'i phyir 'og ma spang bar ni mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma spang ba'i phyir 'og ma spang bar ni mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one does not abandon the lower realms in order to abandon the higher realms.

original: de lta bas na de dag nyid de dag gi rkyen yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag nyid de dag gi rkyen yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should see that the higher realms are the conditions for the lower realms.

original: ci'i phyir 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it said, “When this exists, that comes to be”?

original: rkyen ma spangs pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen ma spangs pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is other than the condition arises from the unabandoned condition.

original: ci'i phyir 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it said, “When this arises, that arises”?

original: rkyen mi rtag pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung la /
analyzed: rkyen mi rtag pa las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung la /
translated: Because that which is other than the condition arises from the impermanent condition.🔽Why is it said, “When there is birth, aging and death come to be”?

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya /
translated: Why is it said, “The condition for aging and death is birth”?

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams kyi bar du yang brjod pa'i tshul 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams kyi bar du yang brjod pa'i tshul 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same method should be applied to ignorance and the formations up to the same method should be applied to birth and old age and death.

original: byed pa med pa'i rkyen las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i rkyen las de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is other than that arises from a condition that is not a cause.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung la /
translated: Why, when birth exists, does aging and death occur?

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste gzhan la mi bya /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste gzhan la mi bya /
translated: Aging and death occur due to the condition of birth, but not from another.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi bar du yang brjod pa'i tshul 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /🔽rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi rgyud nyid la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi bar du yang brjod pa'i tshul 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste / rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi rgyud nyid la /
translated: In the same way, the method of explanation should be applied up to ignorance and formations.

original: de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is other than that arises from conditions that exist in one’s continuum, in one’s continuum itself.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba'i chos gang dag yin pa 'du byed rnams kyang de dag yin nam /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba'i chos gang dag yin pa 'du byed rnams kyang de dag yin nam /
translated: What phenomena arise due to the condition of ignorance are also formations.

original: 'on te 'du byed gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed gang dag yin pa /
translated: Or, are those that are formations

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yang de dag yin nam zhe na /🔽'du byed rnams yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yang de dag yin nam zhe na / 'du byed rnams yin la /
translated: also arisen due to the condition of ignorance?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are formations that are not arisen due to the condition of ignorance.

original: zag pa med pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams so //🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams so // ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
translated: unobscured-indeterminate bodily and vocal formations and mental formations.

original: 'du byed @114b rnams ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed @114b rnams ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are formations that are not conditioned by ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyis bsdus pa'i srid pa'i yan lag ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gang yin pa rnams so //🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis bsdus pa'i srid pa'i yan lag ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gang yin pa rnams so // ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yang yin la /
translated: They are the members of dependent origination that are not included in the members of existence.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang yin pa yang yod de //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang yin pa yang yod de //
translated: There are formations that are conditioned by ignorance and are also members of existence.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: They are the meritorious, nonmeritorious, and immovable formations of the body, speech, and mind.

original: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa ni /
translated: There are formations that are not included in the above three categories.

original: mu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ste /
translated: They are the fourth alternative.

original: de ltar na 'di ni mu bzhir dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni mu bzhir dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the fourfold classification.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa rnam par shes pa yang de yin nam /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa rnam par shes pa yang de yin nam /
translated: Is consciousness that arises from the condition of formations also a formation?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba yang de bzhin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba yang de bzhin nam zhe na /
translated: Or else, is consciousness that which arises from the condition of the formations?

original: 'du byed rkyen las byung ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed rkyen las byung ba la /
translated: There is that which arises from the condition of the formations

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but is not consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa da las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa da las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: It is the members of existence other than consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: There is that which is consciousness

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but does not arise from the condition of the formations.

original: zag pa med pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the pure and the unobscured indeterminate.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: It excludes that which arises from the ripening cause.

original: rnam par shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang yin la /
translated: There is that which is consciousness

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na ni /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba yang yin na ni /
translated: and arises from the condition of the formations.

original: yang srid pa pa'i sa bon du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa pa'i sa bon du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that is the seed of renewed existence and that is the result.

original: rnam pa 'di dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa ste /
translated: That which is excluded from these categories is the fourth alternative.

original: tshul de dang 'dra bar reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar gyi mur bzhir dbye ba yang ci rigs su blta bar bya'o //🔽tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad sred pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshul de dang 'dra bar reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar gyi mur bzhir dbye ba yang ci rigs su blta bar bya'o // tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad sred pa yin nam /
translated: Similarly, the four possibilities should be understood in the same way for the other links up to contact and feeling.🔽Are all those that arise due to the condition of feeling craving?

original: 'on te sred pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sred pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or are all those that are craving due to the condition of feeling?

original: 'di la yang mu bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang mu bzhir dbye ste /
translated: Here, four possibilities are distinguished.

original: sred pa yin la tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni /🔽gong ma'i rnam par thar pa 'dod pa dang / sred pa dge ba la brten nas /
analyzed: sred pa yin la tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni / gong ma'i rnam par thar pa 'dod pa dang / sred pa dge ba la brten nas /
translated: Craving that is not due to the condition of feeling is🔽the desire for the higher liberations and

original: srid pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //🔽tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba sred pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa spong ba gang yin pa'o // tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba sred pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: the abandonment of existence based on virtuous craving.🔽Feeling that is due to the condition of feeling but is not craving is

original: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas /
translated: feeling that arises from contact with the eye and so on,🔽and

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams skye ba gang yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams skye ba gang yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The other factors are the other members of existence.

original: @115a * // tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: @115a * // tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba yang yin la /
translated: The condition of sensation is also craving.

original: sred pa yang yin pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa yang yin pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pa ste /
translated: Craving is the condition of grasping.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: The condition of craving is sensation that arises from contact with ignorance.

original: rnam pa 'di dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o //🔽sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad len pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o // sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad len pa yin nam /
translated: The fourth alternative is that which is not included in these modes.🔽Are all those that arise from the condition of craving the same as grasping?

original: 'on te len pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te len pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, are all those that are grasping the same as those that arise from the condition of craving?

original: 'di la tshig phyi ma yin par blta bar bya ste /🔽len pa gang yin pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la tshig phyi ma yin par blta bar bya ste / len pa gang yin pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sred pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
translated: The answer is that this should be understood in terms of the following verse.🔽All that is grasping arises from the condition of craving.

original: srid pa'i rkyen las byung la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen las byung la /
translated: The condition of existence is grasping.

original: len pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: len pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also that which is not appropriating.

original: len pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams dang / dge ba la sred pa la brten nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: len pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams dang / dge ba la sred pa la brten nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the members of existence other than appropriating, and the arising of wholesome factors such as the exertion of vigor that is dependent on craving for the wholesome.

original: len pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad srid pa yin nam /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad srid pa yin nam /
translated: Are all those that arise from the condition of appropriating existence?

original: 'on te srid pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad len pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te srid pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad len pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, are all those that are existence arisen from the condition of appropriating?

original: sred pa gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni len pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sred pa gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni len pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
translated: All that is craving is arisen from the condition of appropriating.

original: len pa'i rkyen las byung la /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen las byung la /
translated: There is that which is arisen from the condition of appropriating,

original: srid pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: srid pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but is not existence.

original: srid pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: It is the members of existence other than existence.

original: srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad skye ba yin nam /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad skye ba yin nam /
translated: Are all those that arise from the condition of existence birth?

original: 'on te skye ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, are all those that arise produced by the condition of existence?

original: skye ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
translated: All those that arise are produced by the condition of existence.

original: srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba skye ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen las byung ba skye ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also that which is produced by the condition of existence but is not arising.

original: skye ba ma gtogs pa srid pa'i yan lag gi tha ma rga shi gang yin pa'o //🔽skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad rga shi yin nam /
analyzed: skye ba ma gtogs pa srid pa'i yan lag gi tha ma rga shi gang yin pa'o // skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad rga shi yin nam /
translated: It is the last link of existence, old age and death, except for arising.🔽Are all those that are produced by the condition of arising old age and death?

original: 'on te rga shi gang yin pa de dag thams cad skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rga shi gang yin pa de dag thams cad skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, are all those that are old age and death produced by the condition of arising?

original: rga shi gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rga shi gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni skye ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
translated: All those that are old age and death are produced by the condition of arising.

original: skye ba'i rkyen las byung la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen las byung la /
translated: There is also that which is produced by the condition of arising

original: rga shi ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rga shi ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: but is not old age and death.

original: na ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / @115b de las byung ba'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /🔽'khrug pa rnams so //
analyzed: na ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / @115b de las byung ba'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams so //
translated: grief, and despair.

original: srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams las yan lag du zhig yang dag pa'i lta bas bsdus pa'i lam gyi bgegs su gyur pa'i gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams las yan lag du zhig yang dag pa'i lta bas bsdus pa'i lam gyi bgegs su gyur pa'i gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: From among these members of becoming, how many are the principal obstacles to the path that is included in right view?

original: ma rig pa dang de las byung ba'i yid kyi 'du byed rnams dang / srid pa'i phyogs gcig ni bgegs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang de las byung ba'i yid kyi 'du byed rnams dang / srid pa'i phyogs gcig ni bgegs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Ignorance, the formative influence of the mind that arises from that, and one part of becoming are the principal obstacles.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with right view, so it is with right thought and right effort.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams la ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams la ni /
translated: But with regard to right speech, right action and right livelihood,

original: lus kyi 'du byed rnams dang / ngag gi 'du byed rnams dang / srid pa'i phyogs gcig bgegs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed rnams dang / ngag gi 'du byed rnams dang / srid pa'i phyogs gcig bgegs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: the formative factors of body, speech, and mind, and one part of existence.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni yan lag lhag ma rnams bgegs su gyur par blta bar bya'o //🔽srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag las yan lag du zhig ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni yan lag lhag ma rnams bgegs su gyur par blta bar bya'o // srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag las yan lag du zhig ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin /
translated: The remaining members should be regarded as obstacles to right mindfulness and right concentration.🔽Which members among these members of existence are definitely defiled?

original: du ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yin zhe na /
translated: Which are definitely pure?

original: bzhi ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Four are definitely defiled.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The others are both defiled and pure.

original: ngan song rnams dang / de ma yin pa'i mi khom pa rnams su skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ngan song rnams dang / de ma yin pa'i mi khom pa rnams su skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Birth in the unfortunate planes of existence and in the fortunate planes of existence that lack leisure is on the side of defilement.

original: mi khom pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni ;
analyzed: mi khom pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni ;
translated: Birth in the realms of gods and humans, which are not states lacking opportunity,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su blta bar bya ste /
translated: is to be seen as the side of complete affliction and the side of complete purification.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang phyogs de gnyis su ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang phyogs de gnyis su ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining limbs should be seen as belonging to these two sides, as is appropriate.

original: ma rig pa gang med na /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang med na /
translated: When ignorance does not exist,

original: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: formations do not occur.

original: ma rig pa gang 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When ignorance ceases, formations cease.

original: kun nas dkris pa dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / bag la nyal ba rnam pa gsum du gnas pa'i ma rig pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / bag la nyal ba rnam pa gsum du gnas pa'i ma rig pa 'gags pas /
translated: When the three types of ignorance—that is, the ignorance that is an enveloping delusion, the ignorance that is an outburst, and the ignorance that is a latent propensity—cease,

original: ma rig pa 'gags la /🔽de 'gags pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags la / de 'gags pas /
translated: ignorance ceases.🔽When that ceases,

original: de 'gag pa yod na /
analyzed: de 'gag pa yod na /
translated: when that ceases,

original: de las 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro //🔽'du byed @116a * //
analyzed: de las 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro // 'du byed @116a * //
translated: formations cease.

original: gang dag med na /
analyzed: gang dag med na /
translated: When formations do not exist,

original: rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
translated: consciousness does not occur.

original: 'du byed gang dag 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When formations cease, consciousness ceases.

original: 'du byed gang dag rang gi rgyud la byas nas 'gags la gnyen po ma bskyed pa dang / gzhan yang yid kyi 'du byed rnams yod na /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag rang gi rgyud la byas nas 'gags la gnyen po ma bskyed pa dang / gzhan yang yid kyi 'du byed rnams yod na /
translated: The volitions that cease after being produced in one’s continuum and without generating an antidote, and also the mental volitions,

original: lus dang ngag gi 'du byed rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi 'du byed rnams 'byung ste /
translated: if they exist, give rise to the volitions of body and speech.

original: de bas na de yod cing de yod na de'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de bas na de yod cing de yod na de'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, if they exist, consciousness arises due to their condition.

original: de med cing de med par gyur na /
analyzed: de med cing de med par gyur na /
translated: If they do not exist,

original: de mtha' dag 'gags pa las rnam par shes pa 'gag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mtha' dag 'gags pa las rnam par shes pa 'gag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: then from the cessation of all of them, the cessation of consciousness should be seen.

original: rnam par shes pa gang med na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang med na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If consciousness does not exist, name and form do not occur.

original: rnam par shes pa gang 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If consciousness ceases, name and form cease.

original: sa bon du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: sa bon du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: If the consciousness that is the seed does not exist,

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
translated: the consciousness that is the result does not occur.

original: de gnyis 'gags pas ming dang gzugs de gnyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis 'gags pas ming dang gzugs de gnyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: From the cessation of those two, name and form cease.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi tshul ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi tshul ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: As with consciousness and name-and-form,

original: yan lag lhag ma tshor ba'i bar la yang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma tshor ba'i bar la yang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: so should one understand the remaining members up to feeling.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: As with the condition of ignorance giving rise to volitional forces,

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: so should one understand the condition of craving giving rise to grasping and the condition of grasping giving rise to existence.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: As with the condition of volitional forces giving rise to consciousness,

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: so should one understand the condition of existence giving rise to birth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: As with the condition of consciousness giving rise to name-and-form,

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yang de bzhin no //🔽tshor ba gang med na sred pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yang de bzhin no // tshor ba gang med na sred pa mi 'byung la /
translated: so should one understand the condition of birth giving rise to old age and death.🔽If feeling did not exist, would craving arise?

original: tshor ba gang 'gags pas sred pa 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang 'gags pas sred pa 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If feeling ceased, would craving cease?

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i tshul yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o /🔽// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i tshul yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o / // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: The condition of volitional action for consciousness should be understood in the same way.🔽The eight gates of dependent origination

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo rnam pa brgyad bshad pa gang yin pa de dag las /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo rnam pa brgyad bshad pa gang yin pa de dag las /
translated: are explained.

original: sgo du ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: sgo du ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: How many of these gates are distinguished by the twelve members of dependent origination?

original: du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not?

original: sgo gsum ni des rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sgo gsum ni des rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Three gates are distinguished by it.

original: gnyis kyi ni phyogs gcig rab tu bye ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi ni phyogs gcig rab tu bye ba'o //
translated: Two are distinguished by a part.

original: gcig @116b ni yan lag ril gyis rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: gcig @116b ni yan lag ril gyis rab tu phye'o //
translated: One is distinguished by the whole.
