original: lhag ma rnams ni rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
translated: The rest are not distinguished.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i sgo dang / las bdag gir bya ba'i sgo ni phyogs gcig rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i sgo dang / las bdag gir bya ba'i sgo ni phyogs gcig rab tu phye'o //
translated: The gate of the arising of consciousness and the gate of the experience of action are distinguished by a part.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'jug pa'i sgo ni yan lag ril gyis rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'jug pa'i sgo ni yan lag ril gyis rab tu phye'o //
translated: The gate of the entry of the world of sentient beings is distinguished by the whole.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma shes pa la nyes dmigs ji snyed yod par blta bar bya zhe na /🔽lnga ste bdag tu lta bar gyur pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma shes pa la nyes dmigs ji snyed yod par blta bar bya zhe na / lnga ste bdag tu lta bar gyur pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: What are the disadvantages of not knowing dependent origination?🔽There are five: the view of self, the view of a prior extreme, the view of a subsequent extreme, the view of a prior and subsequent extreme, and the view of the middle.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni nyes dmigs lnga pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa rnams nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni nyes dmigs lnga pa'o //
translated: These are the five disadvantages.

original: shes pa'i phan yon du blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i phan yon du blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: What are the benefits of knowing dependent origination?

original: de dag las bzlog pa lnga po de nyid ni phan yon du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa lnga po de nyid ni phan yon du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The benefits are the opposite of those five.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag las yan lag du zhig rdzas su yod ce na /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag las yan lag du zhig rdzas su yod ce na /
translated: How many of these twelve members are substantial entities?

original: smras pa / dgu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dgu'o //
translated: Nine are substantial entities.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are not substantial entities?

original: lhag ma gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The remaining ones.

original: rdzas gcig gi ngo bo nyid du zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas gcig gi ngo bo nyid du zhe na /
translated: How many are of the nature of one substantial entity?

original: lnga'o // rdzas du ma'i ngo bo nyid du zhe na /
analyzed: lnga'o // rdzas du ma'i ngo bo nyid du zhe na /
translated: Five are of the nature of one substantial entity.🔽How many are of the nature of many substantial entities?

original: lhag ma gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The remaining ones.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rgyu du zhe na /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rgyu du zhe na /
translated: How many are causes of the obstructions to the knowable?

original: gcig go // sdug bsngal 'grub par byed pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gcig go // sdug bsngal 'grub par byed pa du zhe na /
translated: One. How many are producers of suffering?

original: lnga'o // sdug bsngal gyi snying po du zhe na /
analyzed: lnga'o // sdug bsngal gyi snying po du zhe na /
translated: Five. How many are the essence of suffering?

original: lnga po nyid do //
analyzed: lnga po nyid do //
translated: The five.

original: sdug bsngal nyid du zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid du zhe na /
translated: How many are suffering itself?

original: gnyis so ; / rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa ni du /🔽'bras bu'i dngos por bstan pa ni du /
analyzed: gnyis so ; / rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa ni du / 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan pa ni du /
translated: Two. How many are taught to be the cause?🔽How many are taught to be the result?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dres pa'i dngos por bstan pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dres pa'i dngos por bstan pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are taught to be the cause and result combined?

original: gong ma drug po ma rig pa nas reg pa'i bar dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams ni rgyu'i dngos por bstan to //
analyzed: gong ma drug po ma rig pa nas reg pa'i bar dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams ni rgyu'i dngos por bstan to //
translated: The first six members, from ignorance up to contact, and the three final members, craving, grasping, and becoming, are taught as the causal entity.

original: tha ma gnyis ni 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan to //
translated: The last two members are taught as the resultant entity.

original: tshor ba ni 'dres par bstan te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni 'dres par bstan te /
translated: Feeling is taught as mixed.

original: tshe phyi ma'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis rgyur gyur pa dang / tshe 'di'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis rgyur gyur pa dang / tshe 'di'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the cause in the sense of being the condition for contact in the next life, and it is the result in the sense of being the condition for craving in this life.

original: de gnyis ka yang reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir 'dres par bstan to //🔽yan lag rnams las du @117a * //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir 'dres par bstan to // yan lag rnams las du @117a * //
translated: Since both are produced from the condition of contact, they are taught as mixed.

original: ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa yin /
translated: How many members are the cause for the establishment of the result that is pleasant and unpleasant?

original: yan lag rnams las du ni las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du ni las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many members are the cause for the establishment of the result that is karma?

original: gong ma drug ni 'bras bu snga ma shos 'grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gong ma drug ni 'bras bu snga ma shos 'grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The first six members are the cause for the establishment of the first result.

original: phyi ma gsum ni phyi ma shos 'grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum ni phyi ma shos 'grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The last three members are the cause for the establishment of the second result.

original: gcig ni 'bras bu de gnyis ka 'grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni 'bras bu de gnyis ka 'grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The third is the one which produces both effects.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many members are associated with the sensation of pleasure?

original: yan lag gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams so //
translated: All the members except the two members of sensation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many members are associated with the sensation of displeasure?

original: de dag nyid dang / gzhag pa las yan lag gcig go //
analyzed: de dag nyid dang / gzhag pa las yan lag gcig go //
translated: The same members, plus one part of the member of sensation.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many members are associated with the sensation of neither pleasure nor suffering?

original: 'di yang bde ba'i tshul bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bde ba'i tshul bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: This question should be answered as the question concerning pleasure.

original: tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many members are not associated with sensation?

original: gcig ste yan lag gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ste yan lag gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One member, namely the member which has been left out.

original: yan lag rnams las du ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus she na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus she na /
translated: How many members are included in the suffering of modification?

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa dang / tshor ba dang mi ldan pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa dang / tshor ba dang mi ldan pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the member of sensation which is associated with the sensation of pleasure, and the member which is not associated with sensation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis du bsdus she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis du bsdus she na /
translated: Are they included in the suffering of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa rnams dang / tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa rnams dang / tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: They are included in the suffering of suffering that is associated with feeling, and in one part of the member that is not associated with feeling.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis du bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis du bsdus she na /
translated: Are they included in the suffering of formations?

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dag ni /
translated: They are included in the suffering of formations that is associated with the suffering of change and the suffering of suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yang de dag yin no //🔽'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus la /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yang de dag yin no // 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis bsdus la /
translated: They are also included in the suffering of formations.🔽There is suffering that is included in the suffering of formations,

original: de ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa yang yod de /
translated: but not in the other two kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / ldan pa gang yin pa rnams dang tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / ldan pa gang yin pa rnams dang tshor ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is the member that is not associated with feeling, and that which is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: ci skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad du kun tu spyod pa'i tshul gyis yan lag thams cad dmigs sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad du kun tu spyod pa'i tshul gyis yan lag thams cad dmigs sam zhe na /
translated: Are all the members of the formless realm focused on all the formless meditative attainments and births?

original: smras pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: smras pa mi dmigs te /
translated: They are not focused on all.🔽The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are focused on the form realm.

original: 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni gzugs can rnams dmigs @117b la ;
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni gzugs can rnams dmigs @117b la ;
translated: The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are not focused on the formless realm.🔽The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are focused on the formless realm.🔽The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are not focused on the form realm.🔽Are the formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm focused on the formless realm?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: They are not focused on the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa rnams su skyes pa la ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su skyes pa la ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dmigs la /
translated: The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are focused on the formless realm.🔽The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are not focused on the form realm.🔽Are the formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm focused on the formless realm?

original: gzugs can rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: They are not focused on the formless realm.

original: yan lag rnams la brten nas yan lag las dben pa thos par 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽smras pa / de'i dus na phyogs gcig las dben par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yan lag rnams la brten nas yan lag las dben pa thos par 'gyur ram zhe na / smras pa / de'i dus na phyogs gcig las dben par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are focused on the formless realm.

original: yan lag thams cad las gtan dben par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /🔽sa gong ma pa'i yan lag rnams la brten nas /🔽sa 'og ma pa rnams las dben par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad las gtan dben par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /🔽sa gong ma pa'i yan lag rnams la brten nas /🔽sa 'og ma pa rnams las dben par 'gyur ro //
translated: The formless meditative attainments and the birth in the formless realm are not focused on the form realm.

original: yan lag rnams las du ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: How many members are defiled?

original: du ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not defiled?

original: gsum ni nyon mongs pa can no /
analyzed: gsum ni nyon mongs pa can no /
translated: Three are defiled.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam pa gnyis so //🔽nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam pa gnyis so // nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni /
translated: The rest are of two kinds.

original: dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba rnams so //
translated: The undefiled are the good ones.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su tha dad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su tha dad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The indeterminate ones are divided into two kinds by way of the specific.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with desire?

original: thams cad ril gyis 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ril gyis 'dus pa'o //
translated: All of them are completely associated with desire.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with form?

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: All of them are partially associated with form.

original: der rga ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: der rga ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should aging be viewed in this context?

original: 'du byed rnams rnyings pa dang / dengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnyings pa dang / dengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the aging and decay of the formations.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽slob pa du zhe na gang yang ma yin no //🔽mi slob pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra'o // slob pa du zhe na gang yang ma yin no // mi slob pa du zhe na /
translated: The formless realm should be understood in the same way as the form realm.🔽How many members are learners? None.

original: gang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang ma yin no //
translated: How many are post-learners? None.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are neither in training nor beyond training?

original: thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad do //
translated: All of them.

original: ci yan lag dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag slob pa pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci yan lag dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag slob pa pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are not the wholesome members that are impure in the realm of training?

original: 'jug par gtogs pa'i phyir mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'jug par gtogs pa'i phyir mi rung ste /
translated: This is not correct, because they are included in the realm of engagement.

original: slob pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa dang / rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa dang / rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wholesome factors that are impure in the realm of training are not conducive to the realm of engagement, because they arise from the condition of knowledge.

original: rgyun du zhugs pas du spangs par brjod ce na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas du spangs par brjod ce na /
translated: How many members are abandoned by the stream-enterer?

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: One part of all.

original: gang yang ril gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang ril gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all of them.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is for the stream-enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so it is for the once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas yan lag du spangs par brjod ce na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas yan lag du spangs par brjod ce na /
translated: How many members are abandoned by the non-returner?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni thams cad do //
translated: All those that pertain to the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams ni nges pa med do //
translated: Those that pertain to the form and formless realms are not fixed.

original: @118a * // dgra bcom pas yan lag du spangs par brjod ce na /
analyzed: @118a * // dgra bcom pas yan lag du spangs par brjod ce na /
translated: The Sūtra master says:

original: khams gsum na spyod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa thams cad do //
translated: The members are all that is to be experienced in the three realms.

original: mdo sde de dang de dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa dus bstan ce na /
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa dus bstan ce na /
translated: In this and that sūtra, how many types of dependent origination are taught?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: In brief, there are six types:

original: lugs su 'byung bar bstan pa dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa dang / phyogs gcig gi yan lag bstan pa dang / yan lag ril gyis bstan pa dang / nag po'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dkar po'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lugs su 'byung bar bstan pa dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa dang / phyogs gcig gi yan lag bstan pa dang / yan lag ril gyis bstan pa dang / nag po'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dkar po'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: the forward order, the reverse order, the order of the members, the order of the members in their entirety, the order of the dark side, and the order of the bright side.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zab po zhes gsungs pa de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni zab po zhes gsungs pa de /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Dependent origination is profound and also profound to realize.”

original: zab pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zab pa ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the profundity of dependent origination be understood?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood in terms of

original: mi rtag pa'i don dang / sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / stong pa'i don dang / bdag med pa'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don dang / sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / stong pa'i don dang / bdag med pa'i don las brtsams te /
translated: the meaning of impermanence, the meaning of suffering, the meaning of emptiness, and the meaning of selflessness.

original: rnam pa bcus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zab par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zab par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination should be seen as profound in ten ways.

original: de la mi rtag pa'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa'i don las brtsams te /
translated: With regard to the meaning of impermanence,

original: rang gi sa bon las kyang skye la /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las kyang skye la /
translated: it arises from its own seed,🔽and it depends on other conditions.

original: rkyen gzhan las kyang ltos pa dang / rkyen gzhan las kyang skye la /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan las kyang ltos pa dang / rkyen gzhan las kyang skye la /
translated: It arises from other conditions,🔽and it depends on its own seed.

original: rang gi sa bon las kyang ltos pa dang / rang gi sa bon dang gzhan gyi rkyen las kyang skye la /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las kyang ltos pa dang / rang gi sa bon dang gzhan gyi rkyen las kyang skye la /
translated: It arises from its own seed and the conditions of others,

original: sa bon dang rkyen las kyang de bskyed pa'i phyir g-yo ba'am /🔽spyod pa'am / byed pa ci yang med pa dang / sa bon dang rkyen las g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: sa bon dang rkyen las kyang de bskyed pa'i phyir g-yo ba'am / spyod pa'am / byed pa ci yang med pa dang / sa bon dang rkyen las g-yo ba'am /
translated: and it is generated from the seed and the conditions.🔽It does not move, act, or function in any way.

original: spyod pa'am / byed pa yang med la /
analyzed: spyod pa'am / byed pa yang med la /
translated: It does not move, act, or function from the seed and the conditions.

original: de gnyis la rgyu nyid kyi mthu yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis la rgyu nyid kyi mthu yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that the seed and the conditions do not have the power to be its cause.

original: yan lag rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la skad cig re re la sar pa sar pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang 'jug go //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la skad cig re re la sar pa sar pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang 'jug go //
translated: The parts are also the characteristics that are renowned from beginningless time, and the characteristics of each new moment are engaged.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /🔽skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can yang yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni / skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can yang yin la /
translated: Dependent origination is momentary,

original: gnas pa'i tshul du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa'i tshul du yang snang ngo //
translated: and yet it appears as though it endures.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba'i don las brtsams te /
translated: In this regard, in terms of the meaning of suffering,

original: yan lag rnams sdug bsngal bar ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams sdug bsngal bar ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la /
translated: the members are of the nature of being of one taste in suffering,

original: rnam pa gsum du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du yang snang ngo //
translated: and yet they appear in three ways.

original: de la stong pa'i don las brtsams te //
analyzed: de la stong pa'i don las brtsams te //
translated: In this regard, in terms of the meaning of emptiness,

original: yan lag rnams sems can dang / byed pa po dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yang yin la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams sems can dang / byed pa po dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yang yin la /
translated: the members are devoid of sentient beings, agents, and suffering,

original: de dang ma bral ba lta bur yang snang zhing ston to//
analyzed: de dang ma bral ba lta bur yang snang zhing ston to//
translated: and yet they appear and are taught as though they are not devoid of these.

original: @118b de la bdag med pa'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: @118b de la bdag med pa'i don las brtsams te /
translated: In this regard, in terms of the meaning of selflessness,

original: yan lag rnams rang la dbang med cing bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: yan lag rnams rang la dbang med cing bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin la /
translated: the members are of the nature of being without self and without power over themselves,

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid du yang snang ngo //
translated: and yet they appear as though they are of the nature of a self.🔽In terms of the ultimate, they are of the nature of being inexpressible,

original: don dam par na brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la brjod pas kyang de'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par na brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la brjod pas kyang de'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: and yet their nature is taught through expressions.

original: shes pa du zhig gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa du zhig gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How many cognitions are there in the knowledge of dependent origination?

original: chos gnas pa shes pa dang / de kho na shes pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: chos gnas pa shes pa dang / de kho na shes pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: There are two: the cognition of the stability of the teaching and the cognition of reality.

original: chos gnas pa shes pas ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos gnas pa shes pas ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known through the cognition of the stability of the teaching?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gzhag pa dang / bstan pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gzhag pa dang / bstan pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It is known just as it is taught by the Blessed One.

original: de kho na shes pas ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na shes pas ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known through the cognition of reality?

original: ji ltar slob pa gzhi rnams mthong ba dag gis zab mo'i don du mthong ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar slob pa gzhi rnams mthong ba dag gis zab mo'i don du mthong ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It is known just as it is seen by learners who see the bases as profound.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ngas byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ngas byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Dependent origination is not created by me,

original: gzhan dag gis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it created by others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether Tathagatas appear or not,

original: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa la /
translated: the nature of reality, the stability of the teaching, and the realm of reality remain just as they are.

original: chos nyid ni gang chos gnas pa ni gang /
analyzed: chos nyid ni gang chos gnas pa ni gang /
translated: What is reality? What is the stability of phenomena?

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of attributes?

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do /
translated: That which is renowned from beginningless time is reality.

original: ji ltar grags pa de rigs pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa ni chos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa de rigs pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa ni chos gnas pa'o //
translated: The presentation of that which is renowned through terms and letters is the stability of phenomena.

original: gnas pa de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na /
analyzed: gnas pa de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na /
translated: Since that stability is the cause of reality,

original: de'i phyir dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the element.

original: gal te skye ba med du zin na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba med du zin na /
translated: If there were no arising,

original: su yang gang du yang skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: su yang gang du yang skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: would anyone arise anywhere?

original: yang na rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yod dam zhes gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yod dam zhes gang gsungs pa la /
translated: Or, even though there is no arising in any way, is there aging and death due to the condition of arising?

original: ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen du ngo bo nyid gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid kyi rkyen du ngo bo nyid gsungs she na /
translated: Why is the intrinsic reality of a condition stated here?

original: 'bras bu'i skye ba sa bon dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i skye ba sa bon dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because the arising of a result is considered to be together with its seed.

original: skye ba'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa'i yan lag rnams yin pas na /
analyzed: skye ba'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa'i yan lag rnams yin pas na /
translated: The seed of birth is the links of consciousness and so on up to feeling.

original: de yang don gyis skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang don gyis skye ba yin te /
translated: Since they are the cause of birth, they are birth.

original: de yong na phis de dag nyid 'bras bur gyur pa la srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yong na phis de dag nyid 'bras bur gyur pa la srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When they exist, they are the result of the condition of existence and are called birth conditioned by existence.

original: de bzhin du yan lag lhag ma ji skad bstan pa rnams kyang ci rigs su blta bar bya'o //🔽yan @119a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag lhag ma ji skad bstan pa rnams kyang ci rigs su blta bar bya'o // yan @119a * //
translated: The remaining links should be understood in the same way, according to the explanation.

original: lag thams cad gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par ma gsungs na /
analyzed: lag thams cad gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par ma gsungs na /
translated: If all the links are not said to be the condition of one another,

original: ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: why are name and form and consciousness established as the condition of one another?

original: ming dang gzugs ni tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur la rnam par shes pa ni tshe phyi ma la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur la rnam par shes pa ni tshe phyi ma la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Name and form are the condition of consciousness in this life and consciousness is the condition of name and form in the next life.

original: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when one enters the womb of one’s mother,

original: gcig gi rkyen du gcig 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma'i mngal du khu chu dang khrag gi gzugs ming gis yongs su zin pa mer mer por 'dres par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig gi rkyen du gcig 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma'i mngal du khu chu dang khrag gi gzugs ming gis yongs su zin pa mer mer por 'dres par 'gyur la /
translated: Because one is the condition of the other, consciousness is the condition for the name-and-form that is appropriated by the embryo in the mother’s womb, which is a combination of semen and blood.

original: ming dang gzugs de'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa des der gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa des der gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the consciousness that arises from the condition of name-and-form obtains a basis there.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nag po'i phyogs la rnam par lta ba na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nag po'i phyogs la rnam par lta ba na /
translated: Why, when a bodhisattva observes the dark side,

original: rnam par shes pa las yid phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las yid phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: does his mind turn away from consciousness

original: yan lag gzhan dag las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gzhan dag las ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not from the other limbs?

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni gcig gi rkyen gcig yin pas na /🔽rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni gcig gi rkyen gcig yin pas na / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Because those two are the condition of each other.🔽Just as consciousness is the condition for name-and-form,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra ba la rnam par lta ba na /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra ba la rnam par lta ba na /
translated: name-and-form is the condition for consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las de'i yid phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las de'i yid phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: When he observes this, his mind turns away from consciousness.

original: de las gzhan pa yan lag rnams las de ltar phyir ldog par ma gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yan lag rnams las de ltar phyir ldog par ma gyur te /
translated: But this is not the case with the other members.

original: de la 'ga' zhig la gcig gi rkyen du gcig 'gyur pa mthong bas na de'i phyir ldog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig la gcig gi rkyen du gcig 'gyur pa mthong bas na de'i phyir ldog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since one sees that one member is the condition of another, one says that there is a reversal.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs la ming dang gzugs ni yang srid pa pa'i rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs la ming dang gzugs ni yang srid pa pa'i rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: In the case of reversal, name-and-form is not the cause of the reversal of consciousness that leads to a new existence,

original: des na gzhan yin par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan yin par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is considered to be different from it.

original: ci'i phyir yan lag rnams bdag nyid kyis byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yan lag rnams bdag nyid kyis byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Why is it said that the members are not produced by themselves,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: not produced by another,

original: gnyis nas byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gnyis nas byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: not produced by both,

original: rgyu med pa las skyes pa yang ma yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skyes pa yang ma yin par brjod ce na /
translated: and not produced by chance?

original: skyed pa po med pa dang / rkyen la g-yo ba med pa dang / rkyen la nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa po med pa dang / rkyen la g-yo ba med pa dang / rkyen la nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no producer, because there is no movement in conditions, and because there is the possibility of conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu lta bu yin /
translated: What is the sprout of suffering in dependent origination?

original: gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su bsrung ba lta bu yin gang ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bu yin @119b zhe na /
analyzed: gang ni sdug bsngal gyi myu gu yongs su bsrung ba lta bu yin gang ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bu yin @119b zhe na /
translated: What is like the sprout of suffering? What is like the tree of suffering?

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams ni myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams ni myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: The consciousness that is conditioned by ignorance and the formative forces, up until feeling, are like the sprout.

original: sred pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba srid pa la thug pa rnams ni yongs su bsrung ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba srid pa la thug pa rnams ni yongs su bsrung ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: Craving, etc. that arise with feeling as their condition, up until becoming, should be regarded as being like the protection.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni sdug bsngal gyi shing lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: Birth and old age and death should be regarded as being like the tree of suffering.

original: yan lag rnams las mar me'i snying po lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las mar me'i snying po lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
translated: How many members are like the wick of a lamp?

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams so //
translated: Consciousness, etc. up until feeling.

original: yan lag rnams las mar lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las mar lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
translated: How many members are like the oil of a lamp?

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
translated: Ignorance, the formative forces, craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: yan lag rnams las me lce 'bar ba lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las me lce 'bar ba lta bur lta ba du zhe na /
translated: How many members are like a blazing fire?

original: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: Birth and aging-and-death.

original: ci'i phyir nag po'i phyogs bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'phel ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nag po'i phyogs bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'phel ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the forward order of dependent origination called the “increasing side”?

original: tha mar 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig por 'gyur ba dang / yan lag thams cad rkyen du gyur cing de las gzhan pa'i yan lag ni de las gzhan pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mar 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig por 'gyur ba dang / yan lag thams cad rkyen du gyur cing de las gzhan pa'i yan lag ni de las gzhan pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it ends in the mass of suffering, which is the result, and because each member is a condition for the next member.

original: ci'i phyir dkar po'i phyogs bstan pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'grib pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dkar po'i phyogs bstan pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'grib pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the reverse order of dependent origination called the “decreasing side”?

original: phyi ma phyi ma spangs pas yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag thams cad sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'grib pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma spangs pas yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ba dang / yan lag thams cad sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'grib pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it ends in ignorance, which is the cause, and because each member is the condition for the next member.

original: yan lag rnams las du ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How many members are called dharmas with cause?

original: dang po bdun no //
analyzed: dang po bdun no //
translated: The first seven.

original: yan lag rnams las du ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How many members are called suffering with cause?

original: de las gzhan pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa lnga'o //
translated: The other five.

original: yan lag rnams las du 'gags na zag pa zad pas rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du 'gags na zag pa zad pas rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How many members are distinguished by the exhaustion of the contaminants?🔽Three.

original: gsum mo // yan lag rnams las du 'gags na rkyen zad pas rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsum mo // yan lag rnams las du 'gags na rkyen zad pas rab tu phye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How many members are distinguished by the exhaustion of conditions?

original: gsum po de dag nyid de de las gzhan pa'i yan lag gi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum po de dag nyid de de las gzhan pa'i yan lag gi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The same three, because the other members are conditions for those three.

original: yan lag rnams las du 'gags na tshor ba zad pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams las du 'gags na tshor ba zad pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How many members are distinguished by the exhaustion of feeling?

original: gcig ste / nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas phung po 'gag pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gcig ste / nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas phung po 'gag pa'i dus na /
translated: One, because at the time of the cessation of the aggregates after the abandonment of the defilements,

original: 'di nyid du tshor ba thams cad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di nyid du tshor ba thams cad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: all feeling ceases in this very life.

original: @120a * // ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la brten nas shes pa bdun cu rtsa bdun rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: @120a * // ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la brten nas shes pa bdun cu rtsa bdun rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the seven bases of knowledge posited in dependence on dependent origination?

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pas brjod ba'i don dang / rang gi rgyud la rang gis byas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa brjod pa'i don dang / sngon gyi mtha' las yan lag rnams kyi thog ma med par brjod pa'i don dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pas brjod ba'i don dang / rang gi rgyud la rang gis byas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa brjod pa'i don dang / sngon gyi mtha' las yan lag rnams kyi thog ma med par brjod pa'i don dang /
translated: The seven bases of knowledge are posited in dependence on dependent origination because they are the bases of knowledge that express the meaning of the afflicted together with its cause, the meaning of the afflicted that one has done to oneself, the meaning of the beginninglessness of the factors in the past, the meaning of the cessation of the factors, the meaning of the path, the meaning of the object of knowledge, and the meaning of the object of knowledge that is the antidote.

original: sngon gyi mtha' las yan lag rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go skabs brjod pa'i don dang / phyi ma'i mtha' las yan lag rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i go skabs brjod pa'i don dang / yan lag du bsdus pa ma yin pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab yongs su shes par brjod pa'i don de rgyu 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas yan lag re re la yang bdun bdun yod pas na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' las yan lag rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go skabs brjod pa'i don dang / phyi ma'i mtha' las yan lag rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i go skabs brjod pa'i don dang / yan lag du bsdus pa ma yin pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab yongs su shes par brjod pa'i don de rgyu 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas yan lag re re la yang bdun bdun yod pas na /
translated: Thus, in terms of these causes, each limb has seven,

original: shes pa bdun cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o//
analyzed: shes pa bdun cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o//
translated: so it should be seen that there are seventy-seven knowledges.

original: ci'i phyir shes pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the forty-four knowledges posited?

original: yan lag re re la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i tshul gyis brtags pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yan lag re re la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i tshul gyis brtags pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: In terms of investigating each limb by way of the four noble truths,

original: bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: there are forty-four.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur la /
translated: In that regard, one born in the desire realm

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyis sa gong ma'i mig dang / rna ba mngon par sgrub par byed na ni des kyang sa 'og ma pa rnams dang / rang gi sa pa'i gzugs rnams kyang mthong la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyis sa gong ma'i mig dang / rna ba mngon par sgrub par byed na ni des kyang sa 'og ma pa rnams dang / rang gi sa pa'i gzugs rnams kyang mthong la /
translated: When one who is in the realm of desire manifests the eye and ear of a higher realm with a body of the realm of desire, he sees the form of the lower realm and his own realm.

original: sgra rnams kyang thos so //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyang thos so //
translated: He hears the sound of the lower realm and his own realm.

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i yid dang ma brtags pa ni lus de nyid kyis mngon du byed do //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i yid dang ma brtags pa ni lus de nyid kyis mngon du byed do //
translated: The mind of the three realms and the uninvestigated are manifested by that body.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pas ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pas ni /
translated: One born in the realm of form or the formless realm

original: sa 'og ma ma gtogs pa thams cad 'dod pa'i khams kyi bzhin du mngon du byed do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma ma gtogs pa thams cad 'dod pa'i khams kyi bzhin du mngon du byed do //
translated: manifests all, except for the lower stages, like the realm of desire.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po //
translated: The three kinds of defilement🔽are the defilement of the passions, the defilement of action, and the defilement of birth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon these,

original: mngon par rtogs pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: one should know that there are six realizations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bsam pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / dad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes @120b pas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / dad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes @120b pas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: realization of the will, realization of faith, realization of morality, realization of the truths by the knowledge of realization, realization of the truths by the knowledge arising from the end of realization,

original: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: and ultimate realization.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa ste lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa ste lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: The stages of the path are five: the stage of the beginner, the stage of practice by means of aspiration, the stage of practicing with firm conviction, the stage of practicing with penetrating insight, and the stage of practicing with full realization.

original: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage of meditative concentration?🔽The summary: The teaching, its arrangement, mental attention, signs,

original: sdom la / bstan dang de yi rnam gzhag dang // yid la byed dang mtshan ma dang // mdo sde rnam pa sna tshogs las //🔽bsdus pa tha mar gyur pa yin //
analyzed: sdom la / bstan dang de yi rnam gzhag dang // yid la byed dang mtshan ma dang // mdo sde rnam pa sna tshogs las //🔽bsdus pa tha mar gyur pa yin //
translated: and the various sutras are the final collection.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The stage of meditative concentration should be understood in brief as:

original: bstan pa dang / de'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / yid la byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshan ma'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mdo sde'i bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang / de'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / yid la byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshan ma'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mdo sde'i bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the teaching, its formulation, the differentiation of attention, the differentiation of signs, and the summary of the sutras.

original: bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the teaching?

original: mdor bsdu na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, the stage of meditative concentration is fourfold:🔽the meditative concentrations,🔽the liberations,

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: the meditative attainments, and🔽the meditative absorptions.

original: bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What are the meditative concentrations?

original: bsam gtan bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ste /
translated: There are four meditative concentrations.

original: dben pa las skyes pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: They are born of seclusion, with applied and sustained thought, born of concentration, without applied thought but with sustained thought, without applied thought and without sustained thought, and with equanimity and mindfulness.

original: rnam par thar pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the liberations?

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight liberations.

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni /
translated: The first is the form realm gods who have form looking at forms.🔽

original: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is for one who has the form aggregate to see forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //🔽sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa ni /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa ni /
translated: The second liberation is for one who has no internal form to see external forms.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is for one who has actualized the beautiful liberation and abides in it.🔽The fourth liberation is for one who has actualized the sphere of infinite space and abides in it.🔽The fifth liberation is for one who has actualized the sphere of infinite consciousness and abides in it.🔽The sixth liberation is for one who has actualized the sphere of nothing whatsoever and abides in it.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /🔽bsgrubs nas gnas pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te / bsgrubs nas gnas pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The seventh liberation is for one who has actualized the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception and abides in it.

original: ting nge 'dzin @121a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin @121a * //
translated: The eighth liberation is for one who has actualized the cessation of perception and feeling and abides in it.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of concentration:

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: yang gsum ste /
analyzed: yang gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three:🔽small,

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
translated: great, and immeasurable.

original: yang gsum ste /
analyzed: yang gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three:🔽associated with joy,

original: dga' ba ldan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ldan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
translated: associated with pleasure, and associated with equanimity.🔽Again, there is the concentration of cultivating one part,

original: yang cha gcig bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gnyis ka'i cha bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang cha gcig bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gnyis ka'i cha bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and the concentration of cultivating both parts.🔽Again, there is the concentration endowed with the cultivation of four concentrations,🔽the concentration endowed with the knowledge of the noble ones,🔽the concentration endowed with five branches,

original: yang ting nge 'dzin bzhi bsgoms pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang 'phags pa'i shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang 'phags pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas shing yo byad dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin bzhi bsgoms pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang 'phags pa'i shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang 'phags pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas shing yo byad dang bcas pa dang /
translated: and the noble concentration itself with its cause and conditions.

original: yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the concentration of the vajra-like samadhi, the concentration of the disciple, the concentration of the post-learner, and the concentration of neither-disciple-nor-post-learner.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /🔽mthong ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa lnga dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na / mthong ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa lnga dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: What is concentration?

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the five concentrations of seeing, the eight concentrations of the spheres of mastery, the ten concentrations of the spheres of totality, the four concentrations of the formless realm, the concentration of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and the concentration of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de'i rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is its definition?

original: ci'i phyir de kho na la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de kho na la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya la /
translated: Why is only that called the stage of concentration?

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the one-pointedness of mind of the realm of desire not concentration?

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde bas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde bas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, this concentration is accomplished by the absence of regret, supreme joy, joy, pliancy, and pleasure.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na yang dag pa'i chos la nye bar sems pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na yang dag pa'i chos la nye bar sems pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is no consideration of the true Dharma in the realm of desire.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The first meditation is called the joy born of seclusion.

original: de @121b mngon sum du byas nas gnas na /
analyzed: de @121b mngon sum du byas nas gnas na /
translated: If one abides in the realization of that,

original: chos lnga spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos lnga spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: five dharmas are abandoned.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba dang / mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: the mental pleasure associated with desire, the mental displeasure associated with desire, the mental pleasure associated with non-virtue, the mental displeasure associated with non-virtue, and the equanimity associated with non-virtue.

original: chos lnga bsgoms pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos lnga bsgoms pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The cultivation of the five factors is also complete:

original: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: supreme joy, joy, fitness, happiness, and concentration.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is satisfaction associated with the realm of desire?

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag 'thob pa'i tshe dang / thob par gyur pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / myong ba la brten nas de dag nyid rjes su dran pa'i yid bde ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag 'thob pa'i tshe dang / thob par gyur pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / myong ba la brten nas de dag nyid rjes su dran pa'i yid bde ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is satisfaction born of the acquisition, possession, use, sight, hearing, or recollection of the five sense pleasures.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba gang zhe na /🔽'dod pa lnga'i yon tan de dag nyid mi 'thob pa'i tshe'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba gang zhe na / 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan de dag nyid mi 'thob pa'i tshe'am /
translated: What is dissatisfaction associated with the realm of desire?

original: de la longs spyod pa mi 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: de la longs spyod pa mi 'thob pa'am /
translated: It is dissatisfaction born of the non-acquisition, non-possession, non-use, non-sight, non-hearing, and non-recollection of the five sense pleasures.

original: thob pa rnams nyams pa dang / 'bral ba dang / chud za ba la brten nas yid mi bde ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa rnams nyams pa dang / 'bral ba dang / chud za ba la brten nas yid mi bde ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is also dissatisfaction born of the loss, separation, or destruction of the five sense pleasures that have been acquired.

original: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is satisfaction associated with the realm of form?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bde ba dang bcas shing yid bde ba dang bcas bzhin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bde ba dang bcas shing yid bde ba dang bcas bzhin pas /
translated: In this regard, some people, while possessing pleasure and mental satisfaction,🔽

original: srog gcod pa na log par lta ba'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa na log par lta ba'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For example, some people kill and engage in the other nonvirtuous actions while experiencing pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is mental dissatisfaction that is associated with nonvirtue?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig sdug bsngal ba dang bcas shing yid mi bde ba dang bcas bzhin pas srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar du 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig sdug bsngal ba dang bcas shing yid mi bde ba dang bcas bzhin pas srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar du 'gyur ba'o//
translated: For example, some people kill and engage in the other nonvirtuous actions while experiencing pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di na rgyal po'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na rgyal po'am /
translated: What is equanimity that is associated with nonvirtue?

original: blon po'am / gang gi bdag po yang rung ba'am /
analyzed: blon po'am / gang gi bdag po yang rung ba'am /
translated: For example, a king or a king’s minister or some other person in a position of authority,

original: bla ma'am / bla ma lta bu la la /
analyzed: bla ma'am / bla ma lta bu la la /
translated: a teacher, or someone of similar status

original: de bdag nyid srog gcod pa'i sdig pa byed mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de bdag nyid srog gcod pa'i sdig pa byed mi 'dod la /
translated: who does not want to commit the misdeed of killing,

original: bsgo ba bsgrub pa'i mi rnams byed na yang yal bar 'jog ste /
analyzed: bsgo ba bsgrub pa'i mi rnams byed na yang yal bar 'jog ste /
translated: but who does not stop those who are carrying out the order to kill,

original: bzlog par mi byed cing 'dul ba la 'god par mi byed la /
analyzed: bzlog par mi byed cing 'dul ba la 'god par mi byed la /
translated: does not oppose it, and does not cause those who are carrying it out to be punished.

original: de yal bar 'dor bas las de byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de yal bar 'dor bas las de byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since one abandons that, one performs that action.

original: des kyang las de myong bar 'gyur te /🔽lkog tu mi 'gyur ba dang / btang snyoms gang mi dge bar rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod bzhin du de @122a * //
analyzed: des kyang las de myong bar 'gyur te / lkog tu mi 'gyur ba dang / btang snyoms gang mi dge bar rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod bzhin du de @122a * //
translated: And because of that, one experiences that action.

original: mi spong bar yal bar 'dor ba dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba la spyod ba na sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi spong bar yal bar 'dor ba dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba la spyod ba na sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant that occurs when one does not abandon that which one has reflected on and investigated as being nonvirtuous, when one is not concealed, and when one is indifferent.

original: mchog tu dga' ba gang zhe na /🔽tshogs kyi sa yongs su dag pa la rnam bar lta ba na /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba gang zhe na / tshogs kyi sa yongs su dag pa la rnam bar lta ba na /
translated: What is supreme joy?

original: dang po nas dag pa'i dga' ba 'gyod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa ni mchog tu dga' ba ste /🔽yid bde zhing sems nyams bde ba'o //
analyzed: dang po nas dag pa'i dga' ba 'gyod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa ni mchog tu dga' ba ste / yid bde zhing sems nyams bde ba'o //
translated: It is the joy that is preceded by the absence of regret when one is looking at the purity of the stage of the equipment.

original: dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is joy?

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa ni dga' ba ste /
translated: It is the joy that is preceded by right application.

original: yid bde zhing sems nyams bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid bde zhing sems nyams bde ba'o //
translated: It is mental satisfaction and satisfaction of the mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is pliancy?

original: gnas ngan len dang bral bas lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bral bas lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the serviceability of the body and mind due to the removal of the unserviceability of the body and mind.

original: bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is well-being?

original: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung ba'i lus dang sems la gnod pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung ba'i lus dang sems la gnod pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: It is the absence of discomfort of the body and mind due to the serviceability of the body and mind. It is also the well-being of liberation.

original: phyogs gang gi gnas ngan len de dang bral bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang gi gnas ngan len de dang bral bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is the liberation from the secondary defilements due to the removal of the defilements of the domain of the latter.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: dmigs pa la yang dag par sems pa'i sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la yang dag par sems pa'i sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind on an object of concentration.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: The Blessed One has said that in the preparatory path of the pure path,

original: ting nge 'dzin snga la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin snga la /
translated: concentration is prior and

original: rnam par grol ba 'phyi bar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'phyi bar gsungs pa ni /
translated: liberation is subsequent.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind is liberated from the defilements only by the power of the accomplishment of concentration.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la rnam par grol ba snga la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la rnam par grol ba snga la /
translated: The sutra states that liberation is prior to concentration in the case of contaminated preparation.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'phyi bar gsungs pa ni /🔽nyon mongs pa spang ba ni sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'phyi bar gsungs pa ni / nyon mongs pa spang ba ni sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The sutra states that liberation is prior to concentration in the case of contaminated preparation.

original: dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning afflictions is the result of mental attention that concludes preparation because it obtains the concentration of the actual basis.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par grol ba cig car 'byung bar gsungs pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /🔽sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin rnams la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam par grol ba cig car 'byung bar gsungs pa ni / 'di lta ste / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin rnams la /
translated: The sutra states that liberation and concentration arise simultaneously.

original: rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yod pa'o //
translated: This is because the concentration that possesses liberation exists in that very mental attention that concludes preparation, in the uninterrupted stage and in the path of liberation that is other than that.🔽The five hindrances are obscurations to the meditative attainment of absorption.

original: de la sgrib pa lnga ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa la sgrib pa gang dag bsam gtan la snyoms par @122b 'jug pa'i tshe /🔽sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa lnga ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa la sgrib pa gang dag bsam gtan la snyoms par @122b 'jug pa'i tshe /🔽sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: When one enters meditative attainment, they obscure it.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscurations are: the obscuration of desire for sense-pleasures, the obscuration of malice, the obscuration of sloth, the obscuration of excitement and remorse, and the obscuration of uncertainty.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration of desire for sense-pleasures?

original: sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: It is the pursuit of the signs of the agreeable.

original: 'dod pa lnga' yon tan dag la lta bar 'dod ba nas reg par 'dod pa'i bar gang yin pa'am /🔽sngon myong ba kun rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga' yon tan dag la lta bar 'dod ba nas reg par 'dod pa'i bar gang yin pa'am / sngon myong ba kun rjes su dran nas /
translated: It is the desire to see, hear, smell, taste, touch and think about the qualities of the five sense-pleasures.

original: rtog par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to remember and think about what one has previously experienced.

original: gnod sems gang zhe na /🔽tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis glengs pa la brten tam /
analyzed: gnod sems gang zhe na / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis glengs pa la brten tam /
translated: What is the obscuration of malice?🔽It is the mental attitude of ill-will towards fellow brahmacarins, or towards anyone else, on account of their having offended, or of one's being offended by them.

original: gnod pa khong khro ba'i rgyu gang ci yang rung ba rjes su dran pa'i sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnod pa khong khro ba'i rgyu gang ci yang rung ba rjes su dran pa'i sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: It is the desire to harm others, on account of the recollection of any cause of irritation.

original: gnod par bya bar 'dod pa khong khro ba'i rgyu de nyid la shas cher rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod pa'i sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par bya bar 'dod pa khong khro ba'i rgyu de nyid la shas cher rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod pa'i sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a mental vexation that is preoccupied with and judges the very cause of anger that is to be harmed.

original: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is torpor?

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyams pa la brten tam /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyams pa la brten tam /
translated: It is a mental and physical heaviness that is favorable to the arising of all defilements, whether it is based on a transgression of morality, etc.,

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsdams pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsdams pa'am /
translated: or on a lack of control over the sense-faculties,

original: kha zas kyi tshod ma zin pa'am /🔽nyal ba'am / shes bzhin med par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: kha zas kyi tshod ma zin pa'am / nyal ba'am / shes bzhin med par gnas pa'am /
translated: or on over-eating,

original: spong ba la sbyor ba ma byas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba dang mthun pa /🔽lus dang sems rmugs pa gang yin pa ste /
