analyzed: spong ba la sbyor ba ma byas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba dang mthun pa / lus dang sems rmugs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: or on drowsiness, or on lack of clear comprehension, or on a lack of application to the practice of abandoning.

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is a lack of serviceability of the body and mind.

original: gnyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is sleep?

original: sems mngon par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sems mngon par bsdus pa ste /
translated: It is a withdrawal of the mind and mental activities.

original: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa bskyed pas spong ba'i sbyor ba 'jig par byed pa la /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa bskyed pas spong ba'i sbyor ba 'jig par byed pa la /
translated: Torpor is favorable to the arising of defilements and is a hindrance to the practice of abandoning.

original: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pas spong ba'i sbyor ba 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pas spong ba'i sbyor ba 'jig par byed do //
translated: Sleep is a preparation for the destruction of the application of abandoning, because it is a contraction of the mind.

original: de bas na de gnyi ga sgrib pa gcig tu gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de gnyi ga sgrib pa gcig tu gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, these two are said to be one obstruction.

original: las su mi rung bar glong ba'i phyir rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: las su mi rung bar glong ba'i phyir rmugs pa'o //
translated: Dullness is a disturbance of unserviceability.

original: mngon par bsdus pas glong ba'i phyir gnyid do //🔽rmugs pa ni gnyid ji ltar skye ba'i rkyen du nye bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mngon par bsdus pas glong ba'i phyir gnyid do // rmugs pa ni gnyid ji ltar skye ba'i rkyen du nye bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Sleep is a disturbance of contraction.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag la ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag la ma yin te /
translated: Dullness is a condition for the arising of sleep, but not for other defilements and secondary defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan ni skye yang srid mi skye yang srid la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan ni skye yang srid mi skye yang srid la /
translated: Other defilements and secondary defilements may or may not arise,

original: gnyid ni glong bar gyur pa la gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid ni glong bar gyur pa la gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but sleep certainly arises when there is a disturbance.

original: rgod pa gang zhe na /🔽nye du @123a * //
analyzed: rgod pa gang zhe na / nye du @123a * //
translated: What is restlessness?

original: la rtog pa'am /
analyzed: la rtog pa'am /
translated: It is a mental factor that is agitated about relatives,

original: yul la rtog pa'am /
analyzed: yul la rtog pa'am /
translated: or agitated about a place,

original: 'chi bar mi rtog pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'chi bar mi rtog pa la brten nas /
translated: or agitated about death.

original: sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' dgur spyod pa rjes su dran par gyur tam /
analyzed: sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' dgur spyod pa rjes su dran par gyur tam /
translated: when you were having fun, when you were enjoying yourself, when you were making love,

original: rjes su dran par byas na sems rnam par ma zhi zhing 'phyar bar skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran par byas na sems rnam par ma zhi zhing 'phyar bar skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: then your mind is not calm, and you are agitated.

original: 'gyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is regret?🔽It is a remorseful reflection on things that have been done or not done,

original: nye du la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: nye du la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid la rtog pa ste /
translated: such as relatives, etc.🔽“Why have I been separated from my relatives,

original: gang du 'di lta bu'i bza' ba dag za zhing btung ba dag 'thung ba dang / de lta bu'i gos dang / zas dang / mal stan dang / nad kyi gso sman dang / yo byad rnams rnyed pa'i nye du de dag dang / bdag ci'i phyir bral bar gyur /🔽ci'i phyir yul der ma song /
analyzed: gang du 'di lta bu'i bza' ba dag za zhing btung ba dag 'thung ba dang / de lta bu'i gos dang / zas dang / mal stan dang / nad kyi gso sman dang / yo byad rnams rnyed pa'i nye du de dag dang / bdag ci'i phyir bral bar gyur / ci'i phyir yul der ma song /
translated: from whom I could have obtained such food, such drink, such clothes, such vehicles, such beds, such perfumes, such ointments, such enjoyments, such riches, such commerce?”🔽“Why did I not go to such and such a place?”

original: ci'i phyir yul de bor nas 'dir 'ongs she'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul de bor nas 'dir 'ongs she'am /
translated: “Why did I leave that country and come here?”

original: ci'i phyir bdag 'di ltar gzhon nur rab tu byung /🔽rgas rgas kyi bar du 'dug pa zhig na snyam pa'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag 'di ltar gzhon nur rab tu byung / rgas rgas kyi bar du 'dug pa zhig na snyam pa'am /
translated: “Why did I go forth as a young man?🔽I should have waited until old age.”

original: sngon bgad pa'am /
analyzed: sngon bgad pa'am /
translated: “I should have laughed when I should have wept.”

original: dga' ba dang / rtses pa la sogs pa rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / rtses pa la sogs pa rjes su dran nas /
translated: and having recalled the joy, the play, and so on,

original: ci'i phyir bdag gang gi dus su rtse ba dang / brgyan pa'i gnas kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gang gi dus su rtse ba dang / brgyan pa'i gnas kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas /
translated: he thinks, “Why did I go forth at a time when I was engaged in the activities of play and adornment,

original: gnas par bya ba de'i dus su nye du rnams ma dad cing mchi mas brnang ba dang bcas pa dang / ngu ba'i bzhin du 'dug bzhin du rab tu byung snyam ste /
analyzed: gnas par bya ba de'i dus su nye du rnams ma dad cing mchi mas brnang ba dang bcas pa dang / ngu ba'i bzhin du 'dug bzhin du rab tu byung snyam ste /
translated: when my relatives were sitting there with distrust and choked with sobs and tearful faces?”

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyi rkyen gyis sems kun tu 'gyod cing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyi rkyen gyis sems kun tu 'gyod cing /
translated: In this way, the mind is filled with regret

original: rnam par 'gyod la /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyod la /
translated: and remorse.

original: 'gyod cing yid la gcags pa skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod cing yid la gcags pa skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the mental distress that arises from regret.

original: de'i phyir rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa gnyis gzhi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa gnyis gzhi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since both excitedness and regret have the same basis,

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad de gsungs so //🔽gzhan yang bya ba'am /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa sgrib pa gcig tu mdzad de gsungs so // gzhan yang bya ba'am /
translated: excitedness and regret are treated as a single hindrance.

original: bya ba ma yin pa ci rigs par byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung ba la /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa ci rigs par byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung ba la /
translated: Moreover, whether one has done what should be done or what should not be done,🔽or has not done what should be done or what should not be done,

original: bya ba'i rigs pa bdag gis ma byas so //
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs pa bdag gis ma byas so //
translated: one thinks, “I have not done what should be done.”

original: bya ba'i mi rigs pa bdag gis byas so snyam ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i mi rigs pa bdag gis byas so snyam ste /
translated: I have done what should not be done.

original: 'gyod pa dang po skyes pa de ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang po skyes pa de ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for the first remorse,🔽if one is unable to dispel that very fetter of remorse,

original: 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pa de nyid bsal ma nus nas phyi ma'i dus su /
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pa de nyid bsal ma nus nas phyi ma'i dus su /
translated: then in a later time,

original: sems kyi rgyun kun tu 'gyod pa dang / rnam par 'gyod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / yid la gcags pas skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun kun tu 'gyod pa dang / rnam par 'gyod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / yid la gcags pas skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: that which arises from the continuum of mind, from remorse, from regret, from remorse, from mental anguish, is a synonym for the obscuration of remorse.

original: gnas ma yin pa las skyes pa @123b gang yin pa de dang / 'gyod pa phyi ma gang yin pa de ni /🔽rgod pa dang / gzhi mi mthun mod kyi ji ltar de g-yengs pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa las skyes pa @123b gang yin pa de dang / 'gyod pa phyi ma gang yin pa de ni / rgod pa dang / gzhi mi mthun mod kyi ji ltar de g-yengs pa'i rnam pas /
translated: That which arises from an improper basis and that which is later remorse,🔽although they have different bases, just as that [remorse] does not pacify through the aspect of distraction,

original: nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way,

original: 'di yang yid mi bde ba'i rnam pas nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang yid mi bde ba'i rnam pas nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this [remorse] also does not pacify through the aspect of mental unhappiness.

original: 'di yang de dang lhan cig tu bsres te gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang de dang lhan cig tu bsres te gsungs so //
translated: This [remorse] is also taught mixed in with that [distraction].

original: the tshom gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gang zhe na /
translated: What is doubt?

original: ston pa'am / chos sam /
analyzed: ston pa'am / chos sam /
translated: It is uncertainty about the Teacher, the Dharma,

original: bslab pa'am / rjes su bstan pa'am /🔽rtogs pa la nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: bslab pa'am / rjes su bstan pa'am / rtogs pa la nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba'am /
translated: or teaching,🔽or understanding,🔽or doubt about the past,🔽or doubt about the future,

original: 'das pa'i dus la nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba ste /
translated: or doubt about the present.

original: de ltar nem nur dang the tshom du gyur pa de'i sems de ni brtson pa dang / rjes su sbyor ba dang / spong ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar nem nur dang the tshom du gyur pa de'i sems de ni brtson pa dang / rjes su sbyor ba dang / spong ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: When there is doubt and uncertainty in this way, the mind does not engage in striving, application, abandoning, or inner serenity.

original: 'das pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with the past, so it is with the future and the present.

original: yang na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la nem nur dang the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la nem nur dang the tshom za ba ste /
translated: Or else, it is doubt and uncertainty about the truths of suffering and so on.

original: sems gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the occurrence of two minds, uncertainty, indecision, and doubt.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nutriment of the hindrance of sensual desire?

original: sdug pa yang yod la /
analyzed: sdug pa yang yod la /
translated: There is beauty,

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
translated: and there is incorrect mental attention to it, and much practice of it.

original: de la sdug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the agreeable?

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi mchog dang / dam pa dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi mchog dang / dam pa dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the best, the most excellent, the most sublime of the agreeable.

original: gang la ma chags par gyur na tha chad du gyur pa gzhan dag la yang ma chags par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang la ma chags par gyur na tha chad du gyur pa gzhan dag la yang ma chags par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When one is detached from it, one is detached from the rest of the agreeable which is inferior.

original: gyad chen po thub na de las gzhan pa'i gyad thub par 'grub pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gyad chen po thub na de las gzhan pa'i gyad thub par 'grub pa de bzhin no //
translated: Just as when one has conquered the most powerful enemy, one can be sure that the others will be vanquished.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the most agreeable?

original: bud med la yod pa'i sdug pa'i gnas brgyad du bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bud med la yod pa'i sdug pa'i gnas brgyad du bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the eight bases of mastery of a woman over a man.

original: gnas brgyad po gang dag gis bud med kyis skyes pa 'ching bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas brgyad po gang dag gis bud med kyis skyes pa 'ching bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: By means of these eight bases, a woman exercises mastery over a man:

original: gar dang / glu dang / bgad pa dang / bltas pa dang / kha dog dang / reg pa dang / cha byad dang / rma 'byed pa rnams te /
analyzed: gar dang / glu dang / bgad pa dang / bltas pa dang / kha dog dang / reg pa dang / cha byad dang / rma 'byed pa rnams te /
translated: dancing, singing, laughing, looking, coloring, touching, posture, and skillful flattery.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i zas yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i zas yin no //
translated: This is the nutriment for the production and increase of sensual desire not yet produced or already produced.

original: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nutriment that is not?

original: mi sdug pa yang yod lade la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa yang yod lade la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
translated: There is also the unpleasant, and that is properly brought to mind and done much.

original: de yang @124a * //
analyzed: de yang @124a * //
translated: There is also the unpleasant, and that is the object of this meditation.

original: gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the meditation on the repulsive.

original: lus 'di nyid mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog pa'o //🔽de ltar nang gi lus la mi sdug par so sor rtog pa dang // phyi rol gyi lus la rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug par so sor rtog pa'i mi sdug pa ni /
analyzed: lus 'di nyid mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog pa'o // de ltar nang gi lus la mi sdug par so sor rtog pa dang // phyi rol gyi lus la rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug par so sor rtog pa'i mi sdug pa ni /
translated: This is the meditation on the repulsive, which is the contemplation of this very body as filled with various kinds of impurities.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kho nar zad de /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kho nar zad de /
translated: Thus, the meditation on the repulsive is of two kinds: the meditation on the repulsive in oneself, and the meditation on the repulsive in others.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba'i zas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba'i zas ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the food for the non-arising of desire for sensual pleasures that has not yet arisen, nor for the abandonment of that which has already arisen.

original: de la yid la byed pas ni mi skye bar 'gyur la/
analyzed: de la yid la byed pas ni mi skye bar 'gyur la/
translated: Desire for sensual pleasures does not arise through the meditation on the repulsive,

original: lan mang du byas pas ni spong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas ni spong par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is abandoned through the practice of that meditation.

original: nag po'i phyogs ni yid la byed pas skyed la /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs ni yid la byed pas skyed la /
translated: The meditation on the repulsive is the antidote to desire for sensual pleasures.

original: lan mang du byas pas ni yang 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas ni yang 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By doing it many times, it increases and expands.

original: gnod sems kyi sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na /🔽khong khro ba yang yod la /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na / khong khro ba yang yod la /

original: khong khro ba'i rgyu yang yod de /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rgyu yang yod de /

analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, the improper mental attention and the frequent practice of it.

original: de la gnod pa la brten nas sems kyi kun tu mnar sems pa ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: de la gnod pa la brten nas sems kyi kun tu mnar sems pa ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: Therein, the mental resentment based on harm is malice.

original: gnod pa de nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa ni khong khro ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gnod pa de nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa ni khong khro ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: That very harm associated with improper mental attention is the cause of malice.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu po rnams la'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu po rnams la'o //
translated: with regard to the nine bases of resentment.

original: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-nutriment?

original: byams pa yang yod la /
analyzed: byams pa yang yod la /
translated: There is loving kindness,

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
translated: and there is the proper mental attention and the frequent practice of it.

original: de yang gzhan gyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa dang / de'i kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po 'dul bas bsdus pa so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni zas ma yin pa ste /🔽gang gis gnod sems kyi sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ba de nyid mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa dang / de'i kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po 'dul bas bsdus pa so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni zas ma yin pa ste / gang gis gnod sems kyi sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ba de nyid mdo las gsungs so //
translated: The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na /🔽mun pa yang yod la /🔽de la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa'i zas gang zhe na / mun pa yang yod la / de la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //
translated: The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.

original: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /🔽snang ba yang yod la /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na / snang ba yang yod la /
translated: The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o //🔽de la snang ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa'o // de la snang ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.

original: mun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / chos kyi snang ba dang / lus kyi snang ba'o //🔽de la mun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ni /
analyzed: mun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / chos kyi snang ba dang / lus kyi snang ba'o //🔽de la mun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ni /
translated: The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.🔽The food of malice is the cultivation of the characteristics of the desire to harm others, and the food of sloth is the cultivation of the characteristics of laziness.

analyzed: mtshan @124b mor rtog pa 'di lta ste / zla ba dang / skar ma la sogs pa dang / nyin mor rtog pa 'di lta ste / nyi ma dang / de gnyi gar rtog pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The night is imagined as the moon, stars, etc.🔽The day is imagined as the sun.

original: me dang nor bu la sogs pa'i snang ba'o //🔽de la chos kyi snang ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ji ltar bzung ba dang / ji ltar bsams pa dang / ji ltar reg pa'i chos rnams la so sor rtog pa'am /
analyzed: me dang nor bu la sogs pa'i snang ba'o // de la chos kyi snang ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig ji ltar bzung ba dang / ji ltar bsams pa dang / ji ltar reg pa'i chos rnams la so sor rtog pa'am /
translated: Both the night and the day are imagined as the light of fire, jewels, etc.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o //🔽de la lus kyi snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o // de la lus kyi snang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The light of the Dharma is the discernment of the dharmas as they have been apprehended, as they have been reflected upon, as they have been experienced, or the cultivation of the recollection of the Buddha, etc.

original: sems can rang las 'od 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rang las 'od 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The light of the body is the light which arises from the body of certain sentient beings.

original: de la snang ba dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mun pa rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /🔽mtshan mo'i mun pa dang / sprin gyi mun pa dang / chos pa'i mun pa 'di lta ste /

translated: The adverse elements of the first light should be understood as threefold darkness:

original: phug la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: phug la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: the darkness of night, the darkness of clouds, and the darkness of places, such as caves, etc.

original: chos kyi snang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /🔽mun pa'i tshogs gsum ste /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni / mun pa'i tshogs gsum ste /
translated: The obscurations to the light of the Dharma are🔽the three kinds of darkness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas /
analyzed: chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas /
translated: When one does not know the Dharma as it really is,

original: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba dang / sangs rgyas dang chos la sogs pa la yang nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba dang / sangs rgyas dang chos la sogs pa la yang nem nur byed cing the tshom za ba ste /
translated: one is doubtful and uncertain about the past, future, and present, and one is doubtful and uncertain about the Buddha, the Dharma, etc.

original: de la ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / the tshom gang yin pa de gnyi gal ni mun pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / the tshom gang yin pa de gnyi gal ni mun pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //

analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas bsdus pa ste /

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /

original: 'jig rten la sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten la sems pa ste /

original: 'jig rten rtag pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa yin nam /

analyzed: rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin nam /

analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin la mi rtag pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: zas ma yin pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yod la /

analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed cing mang du byed pa ste /

translated: Having seen mere phenomena, mere causes of phenomena, mere suffering, and mere causes of suffering, the ignorance that is the basis of improper mental attention does not arise in the three times, and what has arisen is abandoned.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa 'di gnyis bsdus pa la ni /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa 'di gnyis bsdus pa la ni /
translated: In this regard, these two - improper mental attention and proper mental attention - are included in

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: improper mental attention.

original: gang du gang dgos pa de der shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du gang dgos pa de der shes par bya'o //
translated: Wherever it is needed, it should be understood there.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: mun pa la snang bar 'du shes pa'i tshul gyis tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is not proper mental attention, because it is like a light in the darkness.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not improper mental attention,

original: 'di la de ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la de ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is another kind of mental attention that is not that.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The first meditation should be known as having five members:

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: initial inquiry, investigation, joy, happiness, and a one-pointed mind.

original: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The second has four members:

original: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: inner clarity, joy, happiness, and a one-pointed mind.

original: gsum pa ni yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yan lag lnga ste /

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, happiness, and a one-pointed mind.

original: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth has four members:

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //🔽de la bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa @126a * //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o // de la bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa @126a * //
translated: 1. Purity of equanimity, 2. purity of mindfulness, 3. the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, and 4. one-pointedness of mind.

original: dang dpyod pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dang dpyod pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: Among these, the investigation and analysis of the first meditation are for the sake of apprehending the object.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rten gyi don du'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rten gyi don du'o //
translated: Concentration is for the sake of their support.

original: dga' ba ni dmigs pa myong ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni dmigs pa myong ba'i don du'o //
translated: Joy is for the sake of experiencing the object.

original: bde ba ni gnas ngan len bsal ba'i don du'o //🔽bsam gtan gnyis ba'i nang yongs su dang ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba ni gnas ngan len bsal ba'i don du'o // bsam gtan gnyis ba'i nang yongs su dang ba ni /
translated: Pleasure is for the sake of eliminating unwholesome tendencies.

original: dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: In the second meditation, internal clarity is for the sake of apprehending the object.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nang yongs su dang ba'i rten gyi don du'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nang yongs su dang ba'i rten gyi don du'o //
translated: Concentration is for the sake of the support of internal clarity.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnams ni dmags pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin rnams ni dmags pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: In the third meditation, equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are for the sake of apprehending the object.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rten gyi don du'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rten gyi don du'o //
translated: Concentration is the basis of those.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: The purity of equanimity and the purity of mindfulness in the fourth meditation are for the purpose of holding the object-field.

original: ting nge 'dzin de gnyis kyi rten gyi don du'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de gnyis kyi rten gyi don du'o //
translated: Concentration is the basis of those two.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de ma yin pa'i chos gzhan yang yod bzhin du /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i chos gzhan yang yod bzhin du /
translated: Even though there are other dharmas,

original: de dag nyi tshe yan lag tu bzhag pa ni gtso bor gyur pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams la ches phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyi tshe yan lag tu bzhag pa ni gtso bor gyur pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams la ches phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: only these are established as members because they are preeminent and are of the greatest benefit to contemplatives.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas she na /
translated: Why is the first meditation called “with applied thought and with sustained thought”?

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gis 'dod pa'i khams kyang sun 'byin par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gis 'dod pa'i khams kyang sun 'byin par byed cing /
translated: Because it is the antidote to the realm of desire,

original: bsam gtan dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa de dag gi skyon yang mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa de dag gi skyon yang mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is the first meditation, and because one does not yet see the faults of applied thought and sustained thought.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni de dag la skyon du lta bas de'i phyir de dag zhi bar gyur pas na bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni de dag la skyon du lta bas de'i phyir de dag zhi bar gyur pas na bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the second meditation, since one sees those as faults, they are pacified, and therefore it is the second meditation.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa de gnyis skyon du mthong ba'i phyir nye bar zhi bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa la yang dga' ba de skyon du mthong bas nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa🔽la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa de gnyis skyon du mthong ba'i phyir nye bar zhi bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa la yang dga' ba de skyon du mthong bas nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Just as in the second meditation, those two, investigation and analysis, are pacified because one sees them as faults, in the same way, in the third meditation, joy is pacified because one sees it as a fault, and therefore one enters into the meditative absorption of the third meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni bde ba la skyon du lta ba dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pas khyad par du dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni bde ba la skyon du lta ba dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pas khyad par du dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the fourth meditation, one should understand that there is a distinction because of seeing pleasure as a fault and because of the purity of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi rnam grangs ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi rnam grangs ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Here are the synonyms for the meditations:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi sems yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi sems yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the complete purity of the mind of higher mind,

original: @126b yang dag par nye bar sems pa'i phyir na bsam gtan no //
analyzed: @126b yang dag par nye bar sems pa'i phyir na bsam gtan no //
translated: it is meditation because it is the correct meditative object.

original: bde ba la gnas pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: They are also called abodes of happiness.

original: de dag tu bde ba yongs su rdzogs pa myong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag tu bde ba yongs su rdzogs pa myong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one experiences the complete perfection of happiness in them.

original: 'di ltar de dag tu dga' ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi bde ba dang / lus dang sems kyi bde ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag tu dga' ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi bde ba dang / lus dang sems kyi bde ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in them one experiences the happiness of joy, the happiness of tranquility, the happiness of equanimity, and the happiness of body and mind.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyis ni de dag snyoms par zhugs so cog dang langs so cog na /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyis ni de dag snyoms par zhugs so cog dang langs so cog na /
translated: When contemplatives enter into and arise from those meditative states,

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i tshul gyis myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i tshul gyis myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they experience them as abodes of happiness in this life.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe ni /
translated: When they enter into them,

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa mngon sum du gyur nas myong bar byed do //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa mngon sum du gyur nas myong bar byed do //
translated: they experience them as abodes of happiness in this life by making them manifest.🔽When they arise from them,

original: de la langs pa'i tshe ni bdag bde ba la gnas pa 'di lta bu zhig gis gnas so snyam du myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de la langs pa'i tshe ni bdag bde ba la gnas pa 'di lta bu zhig gis gnas so snyam du myong bar byed do //
translated: they experience them as abodes of happiness in this life by thinking, “I have dwelt in such and such a way in happiness.”

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni de ltar myong ba med pas de'i phyir bde ba la gnas pa zhes ma gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni de ltar myong ba med pas de'i phyir bde ba la gnas pa zhes ma gsungs te /
translated: Since there is no such experience in the formless realm, therefore it is not said that one abides in pleasure there.

original: de dag ni langs nas yang dag par bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni langs nas yang dag par bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should rise from those meditative attainments and then teach.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dgon pa la dri ba 'dri ba dag 'ongs la /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa la dri ba 'dri ba dag 'ongs la /
translated: Monks who are questioners come to the forest-dwelling monk.

original: gal te dge slong dgon pa bas der dri ba dris pa la lan ma btab par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dgon pa bas der dri ba dris pa la lan ma btab par gyur na /
translated: If the forest-dwelling monk does not answer the questions asked there,

original: de la gzhan dag 'di skad du kyi hud de gzugs las 'das nas /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag 'di skad du kyi hud de gzugs las 'das nas /
translated: others will say, “Alas, having transcended form,

original: gzugs med pa'i zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa gang yin pa de dag gi dri ba dris kyang lan 'debs par mi nus na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa gang yin pa de dag gi dri ba dris kyang lan 'debs par mi nus na /
translated: he is unable to answer questions about the formless liberations of peace.

original: dgon pa pa 'di'i dgon pa na gnas pas ci zhig bya zhes zer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgon pa pa 'di'i dgon pa na gnas pas ci zhig bya zhes zer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the use of this forest-dweller dwelling in the forest?”

original: de bas na yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug par bya'i gnas par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug par bya'i gnas par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should enter meditative attainment in order to teach correctly, not in order to dwell.

original: bsam gtan ni de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Concentration is also called the “limb of nirvana.”🔽

original: rnam grangs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is described as the 'cessation that is a non-analytical cessation' and also as the 'cessation that is an analytical cessation'.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig spangs pa yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig spangs pa yan lag des mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is described as the 'cessation that is a non-analytical cessation' because it is a cessation that is not definitely fixed as a cessation that is a non-analytical cessation, since it is a cessation that is a non-analytical cessation and also a cessation that is an analytical cessation.

original: ma lus pa mya ngan las 'das ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽de la bsam gtan bzhi ni tshor ba las nges par byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa mya ngan las 'das ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o // de la bsam gtan bzhi ni tshor ba las nges par byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de la yid mi bde ba las nges par byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'o// @127a * // sdug bsngal gyi dbang po las nges par byung ba ni gnyis pa'o //

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par byung ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par byung ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is described as the

original: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par byung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par byung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which definitely emerges from the faculty of pleasure.

original: btang snyoms las nges par byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: btang snyoms las nges par byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa ste / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The fifth is that which definitely emerges from equanimity.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Bhagavān also says in the Discourse on Non-Erroneous Engagement:

original: de la dge slong gis yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skyes pa la skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dge slong gis yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skyes pa la skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Here, a monk knows exactly and as it is that the faculty of mental dissatisfaction has arisen when it has arisen.”

original: gang gi gnas skabs su shes she na /
analyzed: gang gi gnas skabs su shes she na /
translated: In what state is it known?

original: de nyid spong ba la sbyor zhing yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang 'dres pa na sems kyi rgyud shes so /
analyzed: de nyid spong ba la sbyor zhing yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang 'dres pa na sems kyi rgyud shes so /
translated: When it is connected to the abandonment of that very [mental dissatisfaction], and when the mindstream is known to be mixed with the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: de yang rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas /
translated: That is known exactly and as it is, together with its cause, together with its condition,

original: gzhi dang bcas /
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas /
translated: together with its basis,

original: rnam pa dang bcas /🔽'du byed dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas / 'du byed dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: together with its aspect,🔽and together with its formation.

original: rgyu dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known together with its cause?

original: de'i sa bon gyi rgyur shes pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi rgyur shes pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: By the method of knowing its seed cause.

original: rkyen dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know it together with its conditions?

original: sa bon gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa de'i rten shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa de'i rten shes pa'o //
translated: One knows the basis of that which is not included in the seed.

original: gzhi dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know it together with its basis?

original: dngos po gang la gnas na yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skye bar 'gyur ba ste /🔽de yang rgyu mtshan gang yin pa dang / mi shes pa'i sa bon yid mi bde ba'i dbang po kun nas slong ba'o /
analyzed: dngos po gang la gnas na yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skye bar 'gyur ba ste / de yang rgyu mtshan gang yin pa dang / mi shes pa'i sa bon yid mi bde ba'i dbang po kun nas slong ba'o /
translated: It is the thing in which the faculty of mental dissatisfaction arises.

original: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: And one knows that the cause of that is the seed of ignorance which is the motivating force of the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: rnam pa dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know it together with its aspect?

original: 'di ni mi dga' ba'i rnam pa yin no snyam du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dga' ba'i rnam pa yin no snyam du shes pa'o //
translated: One knows that this is the aspect of dissatisfaction.

original: 'du byed dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'du byed dang bcas par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know it together with its concomitants?

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa ni /
translated: One knows that incorrect mental attention and volition are its concomitants.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i 'du byed yin no snyam du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i 'du byed yin no snyam du rab tu shes so //
translated: How does one know it together with its origination?

original: de ltar yongs su shes nas nges par 'byung ba la sems 'jog bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes nas nges par 'byung ba la sems 'jog bar byed do //
translated: Having thus fully understood, he fixes his mind on the renunciation.

original: ji ltar 'jog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jog ce na /
translated: How does he fix it?

original: nyon mongs pa can du rgyu ba las sems bzlog nas yid la byed pa sgom ba la yang dag par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du rgyu ba las sems bzlog nas yid la byed pa sgom ba la yang dag par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He turns his mind away from the defiled activities and applies it to the cultivation of attention.

original: de yang der bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa ma lus par 'gag cing mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang der bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa ma lus par 'gag cing mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: And there, the latent tendencies and the envelopments are completely stopped, and he reaches the end.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyis ni de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyis ni de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: By the mundane meditative concentration, he abandons the bad condition of that side,

original: @127b de'i sa bon gyi gnas de 'byin par mi byed do //
analyzed: @127b de'i sa bon gyi gnas de 'byin par mi byed do //
translated: but he does not extract the seed of that.

original: de lta ma yin du zin nas de phyung bas phyis de mi skye ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin nas de phyung bas phyis de mi skye ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If it were otherwise, then by its extraction, it would be logical that it would not arise again later.

original: zag pa med pas ni de gnyis ka spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pas ni de gnyis ka spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But by the supramundane, he abandons both.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ci lta bu zhig yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ci lta bu zhig yongs su shes she na /
translated: What kind of faculty of sorrow is it that is understood?

original: smas pa / nyon mongs pa can nam /
analyzed: smas pa / nyon mongs pa can nam /
translated: It is said: It is a defiled faculty of sorrow,

original: nges par 'byung ba'i 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po //
translated: or it is a virtuous faculty of sorrow that is associated with the aspiration for deliverance,

original: nang la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
translated: or it is a faculty of sorrow that arises from the power of internal conditions,

original: lus ngal ba'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
analyzed: lus ngal ba'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
translated: or it is a faculty of sorrow that arises from the power of physical fatigue,

original: mes gdungs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
analyzed: mes gdungs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'am /
translated: or it is a faculty of sorrow that arises from the power of being tormented by fire, etc.,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: or it is a faculty of sorrow that arises from the power of being harmed by others, etc., even for one who is free from passion.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la ste /
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure is in the second meditation,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yin par ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yin par ro //
translated: and it is of the stage of the second meditation.

original: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan gsum pa la ste bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin par ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan gsum pa la ste bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin par ro //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is in the third meditation, and it is of the stage of the third meditation.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma spangs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma spangs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that the faculty of sorrow is not abandoned in the first meditation?

original: de na de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negative tendencies of that realm have not been abandoned.

original: ma spangs na yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan du skyes pa la de kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma spangs na yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan du skyes pa la de kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if they have not been abandoned, why do they not occur in one who is born in the absorptions?

original: de'i grogs kyi cha yid mi bde ba'i dbang pos bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i grogs kyi cha yid mi bde ba'i dbang pos bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the suffering that is the portion of the friend of that negative tendency, which is included in the faculty of mental dissatisfaction, has been abandoned.

original: gal te bsam gtan dang po la yang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po de spangs na ni /🔽de'i phyir 'dir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis la /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan dang po la yang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po de spangs na ni / de'i phyir 'dir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis la /
translated: If the faculty of suffering has been abandoned in the first absorption,

original: tshor ba las gyur pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba las gyur pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the difference in the quality of abiding that results from feeling would not exist for the two yogis who enter meditative attainment in the first and second absorptions.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni tshor ba la nges par 'byung bar gsungs la /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni tshor ba la nges par 'byung bar gsungs la /
translated: Because the absorptions are said to be the definite release from feeling,

original: gnyis ka la yang dga' ba dang / bde ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang dga' ba dang / bde ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because both have joy and pleasure.

original: 'di la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bas gnas ngan len spong ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bas gnas ngan len spong ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ci yang med de /

original: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan rnams la yang de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len spangs pas gong ma rnams kyang spong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan rnams la yang de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len spangs pas gong ma rnams kyang spong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of conceptualization is the faculty of complete knowledge.

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo @128a * //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa de spangs na /

analyzed: de dag kyang spong par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de dag gi bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
