analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yan chad na yod par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: From what level upward should the faculty of equanimity be known to exist?

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad nas /
translated: It exists from the fourth concentration upward,

original: srid pa'i rtse man chad na yod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse man chad na yod do //
translated: down to the peak of existence.

original: dbang po lnga po'i nges par 'byung ba mtshan ma med pa la thug pa de rnams ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams lnga po rnams dang gcig gis gcig bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po'i nges par 'byung ba mtshan ma med pa la thug pa de rnams ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams lnga po rnams dang gcig gis gcig bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those five faculties, up to the signless deliverance, should be known as included in each other, as the five elements that bring about deliverance.

original: de la 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams kyi nges par 'byung bas ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams kyi nges par 'byung bas ni /
translated: Therein, the deliverance from desire, malice, and harmfulness

original: bde ba'i dbang po man chad las nges par 'byung bar gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po man chad las nges par 'byung bar gsungs so //
translated: is said to be the deliverance from the faculty of pleasure and below.

original: gzugs kyi nges par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi nges par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The deliverance from form

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa las nges par 'byung ngo //🔽'jig tshogs 'gags pas ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa las nges par 'byung ngo // 'jig tshogs 'gags pas ni /
translated: One definitely emerges from the faculty of equanimity of the fourth meditation.

original: gzugs med pa mtha' dag gi btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa mtha' dag gi btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: One definitely emerges from the faculty of equanimity of the formless realm through the cessation of the perishing of the aggregates.

original: nges par 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of definite emergence?

original: de dag la gnas na nges par 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la gnas na nges par 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that one definitely emerges by abiding in these.

original: des na nges par 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: des na nges par 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Therefore, it is called definite emergence.

original: de dag gis de dag nges par 'byung bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis de dag nges par 'byung bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that these faculties cause definite emergence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yang khams de yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yang khams de yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that the realm exists even for those who are free from attachment.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams dus gcig kho nar spong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba rnams dus gcig kho nar spong bar 'gyur na /
translated: When desire, malice, and harmfulness are abandoned at the same time,

original: ci'i phyir de dag gi nges par 'byung ba tha dad par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gi nges par 'byung ba tha dad par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: why are their definite emergences established separately?

original: de dag gi nges par 'byung ba dus gcig mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi nges par 'byung ba dus gcig mod kyi /
translated: Although their deliverance is simultaneous,

original: gnyen po @128b bsgom pa'i bye brag gis nges par 'byung ba rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po @128b bsgom pa'i bye brag gis nges par 'byung ba rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: it is taught as threefold, according to the differences in the cultivation of the antidotes.

original: de la gnyen po'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gnyen po'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The differences in the antidotes are as follows:

original: mi sdug pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: one should apply the meditation on the repulsive, loving-kindness, and compassion, respectively.

original: de la la la ni mi sdug pa bsgoms pas thams cad la nges par 'byung ngo//🔽la la ni byams pas nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la la la ni mi sdug pa bsgoms pas thams cad la nges par 'byung ngo// la la ni byams pas nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: Some are delivered from all by the meditation on the repulsive.🔽Some are delivered by loving-kindness.

original: la la ni snying rjes nges par 'byung ste /
analyzed: la la ni snying rjes nges par 'byung ste /
translated: Some are delivered by compassion.

original: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba tha dad par ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba tha dad par ston par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that there are different kinds of deliverance.

original: de yan chad la ni gnyen po rnam pa gcig pur zad de /
analyzed: de yan chad la ni gnyen po rnam pa gcig pur zad de /
translated: From this point on, there is only one kind of antidote.

original: de'i phyir yan chad kyi tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan chad kyi tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference beyond this point.

original: lta ba'i shas che na 'dod pa rnams kun tu rjes su dran par 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i shas che na 'dod pa rnams kun tu rjes su dran par 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that one who is dominated by views recollects sensual pleasures?

original: smras pa / so sor rtog pa yid la byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / so sor rtog pa yid la byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: because of the attention to discernment.

original: dngos po gtso bo yid la byed pa dang / longs spyod la shas cher yid la byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gtso bo yid la byed pa dang / longs spyod la shas cher yid la byed pa'i phyir /
translated: 1) The attention of the principal thing, and 2) the attention of the enjoyment.

original: 'dod pa rnams la sems mi 'jug pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la sems mi 'jug pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does the mind not engage in the desires?

original: de la phan yon du mi lta pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan yon du mi lta pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not see them as beneficial.

original: ji ltar dang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one not become confident?

original: de la dga' zhing yid bde ba skyes pa mi bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dga' zhing yid bde ba skyes pa mi bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not cultivate joy and mental well-being towards them.

original: ji ltar kun tu mi gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun tu mi gnas she na /
translated: How does one not dwell on them?

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i dga' bas dga' bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i dga' bas dga' bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not delight in the enjoyment of them.

original: ji ltar mos par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mos par mi byed ce na /
translated: How does one not assent?

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung bar ma mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung bar ma mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not assent to the apprehension of incorrect signs towards them.

original: ji ltar phyir nur bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyir nur bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one turn away from them?

original: rgyas par byed pa na mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa na mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: When expanding, one does not engage.

original: ji ltar phyir 'byed par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyir 'byed par byed ce na /
translated: How does one separate from them?

original: dmigs pa bzung ba 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa bzung ba 'dor ba'o //
translated: One abandons the apprehended object.

original: ji ltar 'jug par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par mi byed ce na /
translated: How does one not engage in them?

original: so sor brtags nas dmigs pa de la 'dzin pa na mngon par mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas dmigs pa de la 'dzin pa na mngon par mi dga' ba'o //
translated: It is a state of mind that is not attracted to the object of meditation when one examines it.

original: ji ltar btang snyoms su gnas she na /🔽mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar btang snyoms su gnas she na / mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su 'jog pa yin te /
translated: How does one remain in equanimity?🔽One remains in a state of balance.

original: mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su sems 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su sems 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: One remains in a state of mental balance.

original: skyo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyo ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is disgust?

original: de la nyes dmigs su mthong nas mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyes dmigs su mthong nas mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a state of mind that turns away from the object of meditation after having seen its disadvantages.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three types:

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: disgust with regard to impermanence, disgust with regard to suffering, and disgust with regard to the transformation of the object.

original: smod pa gang zhe na /🔽dang po la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
analyzed: smod pa gang zhe na / dang po la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
translated: What is contempt?

original: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a state of mind that turns away from the object of meditation after having seen its disadvantages.

original: phyir bzlog pa gang zhe na /🔽@129a * // gnyis pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
analyzed: phyir bzlog pa gang zhe na / @129a * // gnyis pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
translated: What is rejection?

original: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a state of mind that turns away from the object of meditation after having seen its disadvantages.

original: mi mthun pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is aversion?

original: gsum pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
analyzed: gsum pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
translated: It is a state of mind that turns away from the object of meditation after having seen its disadvantages.

original: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the very thing that is not in accord.

original: de las bzlog pa la ni nges par 'byung ba yid la byed da /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la ni nges par 'byung ba yid la byed da /
translated: One attends to the mental orientation of renunciation, which is the opposite of that.

original: 'jug pa ni de la phan yon du lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni de la phan yon du lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One engages in it because one sees its benefit.

original: dang ba ni dad pa dang / mngon par yid ches pas mngon par dang pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ba ni dad pa dang / mngon par yid ches pas mngon par dang pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One has confidence in it because one generates a clear faith through conviction and trust.

original: kun tu gnas pa ni de la dmigs pa las mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu gnas pa ni de la dmigs pa las mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One remains in it because one does not stray from the object.

original: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: One is liberated from it because one is free from the afflictions.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'jug pas so //
translated: One engages in it without afflictions.

original: de la skyo ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rnam pa rnams la gnas pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de la skyo ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rnam pa rnams la gnas pa'i tshe ni /
translated: When one remains in the aspects of the mind that are not in accord with it, such as the weariness of the mind,

original: de'i sems de nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sems de nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: one's mind does not become weak.

original: btang snyoms su gyur na yang rtsol ba med do //
analyzed: btang snyoms su gyur na yang rtsol ba med do //
translated: Even when one is indifferent to it, one does not make an effort to engage in it.

original: ji ltar de'i sems de bde bar song ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i sems de bde bar song ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one's mind become happy?

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one remains in the mental orientation of the culmination of application.

original: ji ltar legs par bsgoms pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par bsgoms pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it well cultivated?

original: de las gzhan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams la legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams la legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is well cultivated in relation to other mental attentions.

original: des na spong ba'i gnas skabs dang / spong ba'i sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang bstan par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: des na spong ba'i gnas skabs dang / spong ba'i sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang bstan par 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus, the state of abandonment and the state of the path of application for abandonment are also indicated.

original: de la grol ba ni kun nas dkris pa las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la grol ba ni kun nas dkris pa las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, liberation is due to complete liberation from the entanglements.

original: rnam par grol ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par rab tu grol ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rab tu grol ba ni /
translated: Complete liberation is due to complete liberation from the signs of the objective field.

original: bag la nyal las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Complete deliverance is due to complete liberation from the latent propensities.

original: de'i 'dod pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa gang dag skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa gang dag skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The defilements that arise due to the condition of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma gtogs pa /
translated: except for the passion of desire,

original: de las gzhan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: are the other defilements that pertain to the realm of desire.

original: phongs pa rnams ni gzhi de kho na las nyes par spyod pa'i khyad par chad pas gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba gang dag yin pa ste ;
analyzed: phongs pa rnams ni gzhi de kho na las nyes par spyod pa'i khyad par chad pas gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba gang dag yin pa ste ;
translated: The poor are those who, on that basis, commit various kinds of evil actions, such as stealing, and are punished by having their hands and feet cut off.

original: gang dag byas shing bstsags na ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag byas shing bstsags na ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who have done and accumulated such actions are reborn in the lower realms.

original: yongs su gdung ba rnams ni gzhi de las 'dod pa'i sred pas za ba na lus dang sems kyi yongs su sreg pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba rnams ni gzhi de las 'dod pa'i sred pas za ba na lus dang sems kyi yongs su sreg pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who are tormented are those who, on that basis, are tormented by craving for sense objects, and are burned by the fire of passion in both body and mind.

original: 'khrug pa rnams ni gzhi de las de'i dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba mya ngan @129b dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa rnams ni gzhi de las de'i dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba mya ngan @129b dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who are agitated are those who, on that basis, are agitated by the transformation of their objects, by grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: grol ba ni de dag las de langs pa ste /
analyzed: grol ba ni de dag las de langs pa ste /
translated: Those who are liberated are those who have risen above those.

original: bral ba dang yongs su bral ba zhes bya ba yang snga ma ltar kun nas dkris pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bag la nyal ba las rnam par thar pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bral ba dang yongs su bral ba zhes bya ba yang snga ma ltar kun nas dkris pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bag la nyal ba las rnam par thar pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: “Freedom” and “complete freedom” are also like the former, because of being liberated from the envelopment, the objective support, and the latent propensities, respectively.

original: ji ltar de de'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba myong bar mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de de'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba myong bar mi byed ce na /
translated: How is it that he does not experience the feeling that arises from that condition?

original: yul la dmigs par 'dod pa'am dmigs pa'i tshe'am /
analyzed: yul la dmigs par 'dod pa'am dmigs pa'i tshe'am /
translated: When he desires to take an object as his objective support, or when he takes it as his objective support,

original: rjes su dran pa na yang rung ste /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa na yang rung ste /
translated: or when he recollects it,

original: rten des nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten des nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: the feeling that arises from that object does not become defiled, because the defiled feeling does not arise in that basis.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa 'dug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa 'dug pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a drop of water on a lotus leaf does not spread,

original: de'i rten nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gos pa med par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rten nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gos pa med par gnas so //
translated: so the defilements do not adhere to that basis.

original: drug po 'di dag ni nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i khams te /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag ni nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i khams te /
translated: These six are the elements to be liberated,

original: de dag kyang mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: and they are just as they are described in the sutra.

original: bdag gi byams pa bsgoms pa nas /
analyzed: bdag gi byams pa bsgoms pa nas /
translated: “I cultivate loving-kindness” up to “I cultivate the perception of impermanence.”

original: bdag ni nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang yang bral ba'i bar du yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang yang bral ba'i bar du yin mod kyi /
translated: and up to the point where one is free from the notion that the self is the self.🔽Nevertheless, my mind is completely bound up with the pain of doubt and uncertainty.

original: 'on kyang bdag gi sems ni the tshom dang nem nur gyi zug rdus yongs su dkris te 'dug ces bya ba ni de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po ma yin no snyam pa'i nyes par bzung ba 'dor du gzhug pa'i
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gi sems ni the tshom dang nem nur gyi zug rdus yongs su dkris te 'dug ces bya ba ni de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po ma yin no snyam pa'i nyes par bzung ba 'dor du gzhug pa'i
translated: In order to eliminate the fault that one might think, “Therefore, love, etc. are not the antidotes to malice, etc.,”

original: phyir / 'di dag rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyir / 'di dag rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should see that they are established in the following way.

original: de la gzhi ni gnod sems la sogs pa dang bral ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhi ni gnod sems la sogs pa dang bral ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The basis is established by the special antidote that is free from malice, etc.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i gnyen po dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'thob pa la yongs su rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i gnyen po dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'thob pa la yongs su rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The signless is the antidote to the sign, and is the way of thorough understanding in attaining the noble abodes.

original: drug pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba la yongs su rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: drug pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba la yongs su rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The sixth is the way of thorough understanding in going to the ultimate.

original: byams pa ni kun nas mnar sems med par 'jug pas na /
analyzed: byams pa ni kun nas mnar sems med par 'jug pas na /
translated: Love is the antidote to malice, because it engages without hostility.

original: gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: It is the antidote to malice.

original: snying rje ni pha rol gyi sdug bsngal bstsal ba lhag pa'i bsam pas 'jug pas na rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po'o //🔽dga' ba ni pha rol gyi bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pas 'jug pas na /
analyzed: snying rje ni pha rol gyi sdug bsngal bstsal ba lhag pa'i bsam pas 'jug pas na rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po'o // dga' ba ni pha rol gyi bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pas 'jug pas na /
translated: Compassion is the antidote to violence, for it engages with the thought of removing the suffering of others.

original: mi dga' ba'i gnyen po'o //🔽btang snyoms ni gnyis ka la lhag par btang snyoms pas na /🔽'dod pa'i 'dod @130a * //
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i gnyen po'o // btang snyoms ni gnyis ka la lhag par btang snyoms pas na / 'dod pa'i 'dod @130a * //
translated: Joy is the antidote to displeasure, for it engages with the thought of rejoicing in the happiness of others.

original: chags dang / gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o //🔽mtshan ma med ba ni mtshan ma dang mi mthun pas na /
analyzed: chags dang / gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o // mtshan ma med ba ni mtshan ma dang mi mthun pas na /
translated: Equanimity is the antidote to desire and malice, for it engages with the thought of equanimity toward both.

original: mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: The signless is the antidote to all signs, for it is incompatible with signs.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba la ni /🔽rang gi rnam par thar pa'am /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba la ni / rang gi rnam par thar pa'am /
translated: One who is free from the pride that thinks “I am”🔽has no doubt about his own liberation

original: rtog pa la nem nur yod mi srid de /
analyzed: rtog pa la nem nur yod mi srid de /
translated: or about the path.

original: de bas na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba ni de'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba ni de'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Therefore, freedom from the pride that thinks “I am” is the antidote to that.

original: gnod sems thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnod sems thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the definite release from all malice.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba kho na'o zhes gcig tu nges par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba kho na'o zhes gcig tu nges par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the definite release itself, it is made certain that it is just this.

original: gnod sems la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod do zhes bya ba ni ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod sems la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod do zhes bya ba ni ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of the occurrence of malice, etc. is due to lack of cultivation.

original: de la nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i khams snga ma lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i khams snga ma lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las /
translated: Among the first five elements that are to be definitely released,

original: snga ma bzhi ni lha'i gnas pas bsdus so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhi ni lha'i gnas pas bsdus so //
translated: the first four are included in the divine abodes.

original: lnga pa ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas bsdus so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas bsdus so //
translated: The fifth is included in the noble abodes.

original: yang nges par 'byung ba drug po dag las bzhi ni tshangs pa'i gnas pas bsdus so //
analyzed: yang nges par 'byung ba drug po dag las bzhi ni tshangs pa'i gnas pas bsdus so //
translated: Moreover, among the six definite releases, the first four are included in the Brahma abodes.

original: lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas bsdus pa kho na yin te /🔽de la gnod sems la sogs pa'i nyes pa las yang dag par 'das pas na /
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis ni 'phags pa'i gnas pas bsdus pa kho na yin te / de la gnod sems la sogs pa'i nyes pa las yang dag par 'das pas na /
translated: The fifth and sixth are included in the noble abodes alone.

original: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, it is called definite release because one has gone beyond the faults of malice, etc.

original: rton pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rton pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The supports are

original: nges par 'byung ba de la brtan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba de la brtan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: One should rely on the Dharma, not on the person.

original: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la brtan gyi gang zag la ma yin /
analyzed: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la brtan gyi gang zag la ma yin /
translated: The Bhagavat has said that one should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: don la brten gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la brtan gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin /🔽ye shes la brtan gyi /
analyzed: don la brten gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la brtan gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin / ye shes la brtan gyi /
translated: One should rely on the sutras of definitive meaning, not on those of provisional meaning.

original: rnam par shes pa la ma yin zhes bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ma yin zhes bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should rely on gnosis, not on consciousness.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they to be established?

original: gang zag rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag gis te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag gis te /
translated: By the distinctions of four kinds of persons.

original: dang po ni tshul 'chos pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: dang po ni tshul 'chos pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
translated: The first is the distinction of the person who is a hypocrite.

original: gnyis pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
translated: The second is the distinction of the person who is a materialist.

original: gsum pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gi bye brag gis so //
translated: The third is the distinction of the person who is attached to his own views.

original: bzhi pa ni thos pa lhur len pa'i gang zag gis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni thos pa lhur len pa'i gang zag gis so //
translated: The fourth is the distinction of the person who is devoted to listening.

original: de la tshul 'chos pa ni chos la brtan gyi /
analyzed: de la tshul 'chos pa ni chos la brtan gyi /
translated: Hypocrisy is to be steadfast in the Dharma,

original: gang zag la ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: but not in the person.

original: 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par nges par byas nas /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par nges par byas nas /
translated: Having ascertained the meaning through related discussions,

original: shes pas rtogs @130b par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pas rtogs @130b par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: one should understand it through wisdom,

original: spyod lam tsam gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod lam tsam gyis ma yin no //
translated: not just through behavior.

original: de'i rnam grangs gzhan yang /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs gzhan yang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag kyang gsungs la /
translated: There is another enumeration:🔽The Blessed One has taught both the person and the Dharma.

original: chos kyang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: chos kyang gsungs pa de la /
translated: Among them,

original: chos kho na la brtan gyi gang zag la ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kho na la brtan gyi gang zag la ma yin te /
translated: one should be steadfast in the Dharma, not in the person,

original: yul gyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig ni mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig ni mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the etymology of the word “person” is not something to be clung to.

original: chos de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That Dharma is also of two kinds:

original: tshig 'bru dang don to //
analyzed: tshig 'bru dang don to //
translated: words and meaning.

original: de la don la brtan gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la don la brtan gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa ni /
translated: Among them, being steadfast in the meaning, not in the words,

original: thos pa lhur blang bar mi bya'o /
analyzed: thos pa lhur blang bar mi bya'o /
translated: one should not be devoted to mere learning.

original: don la bsam par bya /
analyzed: don la bsam par bya /
translated: One should contemplate the meaning,

original: gzhal bar bya /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya /
translated: appraise it,

original: nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: and examine it closely.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ni mdo las nges pa'i don yang gsungs la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ni mdo las nges pa'i don yang gsungs la /
translated: In that regard, the Blessed One has taught the definitive meaning in the sūtras,🔽and he has also taught the interpretable meaning.

original: drang ba'i don kyang gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: drang ba'i don kyang gsungs mod kyi /
translated: But,

original: de la don la nye bar rtog pas /
analyzed: de la don la nye bar rtog pas /
translated: by investigating the meaning,

original: nges pas don gyi mdo sde la brtan gyi /
analyzed: nges pas don gyi mdo sde la brtan gyi /
translated: one should rely on the sutras of definitive meaning,

original: drang ba'i don la ma yin no //
analyzed: drang ba'i don la ma yin no //
translated: not on those of interpretable meaning.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod nams dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir gsungs la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod nams dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir gsungs la /
translated: The Bhagavat taught that consciousnesses tending toward merit and the imperturbable lead to good destinies.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i shes pa yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i shes pa yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gsungs pa de la /
translated: He taught that the knowledge of the four noble truths leads to nirvana.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas ye shes la brten gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas ye shes la brten gyi /
translated: Therefore, one should rely on the knowledge that accords with the Dharma,

original: rnam par shes pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ma yin no //
translated: not on consciousness.

original: de la mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: dus bzhir chud za bar 'gyur ba dang / chud za bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gang zag bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dus bzhir chud za bar 'gyur ba dang / chud za bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gang zag bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: there are four kinds of persons, because they either waste or do not waste the four periods of opportunity.

original: chos kun chub par byed pa'i dus dang / 'dzin pa'i dus dang / don la nye bar rtog pa'i dus dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dus las rton pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kun chub par byed pa'i dus dang / 'dzin pa'i dus dang / don la nye bar rtog pa'i dus dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dus las rton pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The four reliances are established with regard to the time of understanding the teaching, the time of retaining the teaching, the time of investigating the meaning, and the time of practicing the teaching in accordance with the meaning.

original: rnam par gzhag pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa rdzogs so /
translated: The presentation is complete.

original: // / bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di dag las /
analyzed: // / bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di dag las /
translated: Among these, the meditative states and so on,

original: yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: the attentions and the objects should be understood.

original: de la yid la byed pa dag ni /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa dag ni /
translated: Among them, the attentions are

original: dngos gzhi bdun dang / yid la byed pa gzhan bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bdun dang / yid la byed pa gzhan bzhi bcu'o //

original: yid la byed pa dngos gzhi bdun po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dngos gzhi bdun po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven fundamental attentions?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud par byed pa dang / dpyod pa'i yid la byed ba dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba @131a * //

analyzed: yid la byed pa gzhan bzhi bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the other forty mental attentions?

original: de kho na yid la byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis tshul bzhin kyi chos yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis tshul bzhin kyi chos yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attention of reality is the attention which properly takes to mind the Dharma through the characteristics of its own nature, the characteristics of its general nature, and the characteristics of its suchness.

original: slob pa'i ni ngo bo nyid dang / rgyud las rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: slob pa'i ni ngo bo nyid dang / rgyud las rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attention of the trainee is twofold: by nature and by continuum.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the attention by nature is any uncontaminated attention of the trainee.

original: rgyud la ni slob pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa thams cad do //
analyzed: rgyud la ni slob pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa thams cad do //
translated: The attention by continuum is all virtuous attention of the trainee.

original: slob pa'i ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: slob pa'i ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the trainee,

original: mi slob pa'i yang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: the attention of the non-trainee should be understood as twofold in the same way.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i ni /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i ni /
translated: The attention of neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee

original: 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad do //
translated: is all mundane attention.

original: yongs su shes pa'i yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa gang gis dmigs pa yongs su shes la /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa gang gis dmigs pa yongs su shes la /
translated: The attention of complete knowledge is the attention by which one completely knows the focal object.

original: nyon mongs pa ni spong bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni spong bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not eliminate the afflictions.

original: spong ba yid la byed ba ni /
analyzed: spong ba yid la byed ba ni /
translated: The attention of elimination is

original: gang gis gnyis ka byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gnyis ka byed pa'o //
translated: that by which one does both.

original: spangs pa'i tshe'i yid la byed pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i tshe'i yid la byed pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i rjes la yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attention of the time of elimination is the attention that occurs after the elimination of the afflictions.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yid la byed pa ni gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i lus la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa yid la byed pa ni gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i lus la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
translated: The attention that has a conceptual image as its object is that by which one cultivates insight with a conceptual body as its object.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni /
translated: The attention that has a nonconceptual image as its object is

original: gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i lus la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i lus la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas bsgom pa'o //
translated: that by which one cultivates serenity with a nonconceptual body as its object.

original: dngos po'i mtha' la dmigs pa ni gang gis lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i mtha' la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' la dmigs pa ni gang gis lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i mtha' la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The attention that has the limit of existence as its object is that by which one has as one's object the limit of the body, etc.

original: de las lus med pa nas chos kyi bar du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las lus med pa nas chos kyi bar du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , because there is no body, etc.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention that focuses on the accomplishment of one's purpose is the attention that thinks,🔽If I attend to this,

original: bdag 'di yid la byed pa dang / bdag 'di ltar yid la byed na /
analyzed: bdag 'di yid la byed pa dang / bdag 'di ltar yid la byed na /
translated: then this and this will result,

original: 'di dang 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: and this and this will be accomplished.

original: 'di dang 'di yang 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su dag pa la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //🔽mos @132a * //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di yang 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su dag pa la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa'o // mos @132a * //
translated: The attention that focuses on complete purity is the attention that focuses on the Dharma body of the Tathagata.

original: pa rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni gang gis thog ma nas /
analyzed: pa rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni gang gis thog ma nas /
translated: The attention that discerns devotion is the attention that, from the very beginning,

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa'am /
translated: discerns the Dharma or

original: yang na zhi gnas sngon du btang ste /🔽rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhi gnas sngon du btang ste / rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: that discerns the Dharma after first cultivating serenity.

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni /🔽thog ma nas sems nang du 'jog pa'am /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni / thog ma nas sems nang du 'jog pa'am /
translated: The attention that pacifies is the attention that, from the very beginning,🔽places the mind inwardly or

original: yang na lhag mthong sngon du btang ste 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lhag mthong sngon du btang ste 'jog pa'o //
translated: that places the mind after first discerning insight.

original: cha gcig bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: cha gcig bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention that cultivates a portion is the attention that cultivates

original: gang gis zhi gnas sam /
analyzed: gang gis zhi gnas sam /
translated: either serenity or

original: yang na lhag mthong cha gcig la bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lhag mthong cha gcig la bsgom pa'o //
translated: insight in a portion.

original: gnyi ga'i cha bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The conscientious attitude of meditation on both is

original: gang gis gnyis ka zung du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gnyis ka zung du bsgom pa'o //
translated: that by which one meditates on both.

original: rtag tu yid la byed pa ni dus thams cad du bar chad med par rgyun du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu yid la byed pa ni dus thams cad du bar chad med par rgyun du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of constant practice is that which occurs uninterruptedly at all times.

original: bsti stang du byas te yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: bsti stang du byas te yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The conscientious attitude of practice with respect is

original: mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which arises from the application of not being lax.

original: de la mos pa rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pas ni ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par byed do //
analyzed: de la mos pa rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pas ni ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par byed do //
translated: Among these, the conscientious attitude of discernment of devotion purifies the vision of intuition.

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pas ni shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pas ni shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed do //
translated: The conscientious attitude of pacification generates pliancy.

original: cha gcig bsgom pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha bsgoms pas ni sgrib pa rnams las sems grol bar byed do //
analyzed: cha gcig bsgom pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha bsgoms pas ni sgrib pa rnams las sems grol bar byed do //
translated: The conscientious attitude of meditation on one part and the conscientious attitude of meditation on both parts liberate the mind from the obscurations.

original: rtag tu yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: rtag tu yid la byed pas ni /
translated: The conscientious attitude of constant practice

original: dus chud mi za bar byed do //
analyzed: dus chud mi za bar byed do //
translated: prevents the loss of time.

original: bsti stang du byas te yid la byed pas ni mngon par shes pa myur bar 'thob par byed do //
analyzed: bsti stang du byas te yid la byed pas ni mngon par shes pa myur bar 'thob par byed do //
translated: The conscientious attitude of practice with respect quickly attains the superknowledges.

original: mthun pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: mthun pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: Attention derived from harmony.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba dang mthun pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba dang mthun pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The attention that is favorable is that which is favorable to the abandonment of the defilements.

original: des ni dmigs pa sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: des ni dmigs pa sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: It is the attention that rejects the object-field.

original: gnyen po las byung ba ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / spong ba 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams las rgyud thag ring du byed pa'o //🔽dang par bya bar 'os pa yid la byed pa ni /🔽rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: gnyen po las byung ba ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / spong ba 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams las rgyud thag ring du byed pa'o // dang par bya bar 'os pa yid la byed pa ni / rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa'am /
translated: The attention that is the counter-agent is that by which one abandons the defilements, by which one takes hold of the abandonment, by which one keeps the defilements at a distance.

original: dad par bya bar 'os pa'i dngos po gzhan gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dad par bya bar 'os pa'i dngos po gzhan gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attention that is to be practiced is the cultivation of the six recollections or else, any attention that is to be practiced.

original: so sor brtag par 'os pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / spong ba yongs su dpyod pa'am /🔽yang na bdag gis rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: so sor brtag par 'os pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / spong ba yongs su dpyod pa'am / yang na bdag gis rtogs pa'am /
translated: The attention that is to be examined is that by which one examines whether the defilements have been abandoned or not, or whether one is abandoning them.

original: sngon dpyad pa'i chos rnams la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dpyad pa'i chos rnams la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the attention that examines the doctrine that one has understood or that one has examined previously.

original: bsgrims te 'jug pa ni las dang po pa yid la byed pa ma thob pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrims te 'jug pa ni las dang po pa yid la byed pa ma thob pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Tightly focused attention is that of beginners who have not yet attained attention.

original: skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa ni yid la @132b byed pa 'thob pa rnams kyi rjes la sbyor ba lhod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //🔽rtsol ba dang bcas par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa ni yid la @132b byed pa 'thob pa rnams kyi rjes la sbyor ba lhod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o // rtsol ba dang bcas par 'jug pa ni /
translated: Intermittent attention is that of those who have attained attention but whose application is slack.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa sbyor ba mi lhod pa de dag nyid kyi gang yin pa'o //🔽rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa sbyor ba mi lhod pa de dag nyid kyi gang yin pa'o // rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni /
translated: Attention with effort is that of those who have begun to make effort and whose application is not slack.

original: dus bzhi po yid la byed pa 'thob pa'i dus dang dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa dang thob zin pa'i dus su nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //🔽rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: dus bzhi po yid la byed pa 'thob pa'i dus dang dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa dang thob zin pa'i dus su nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o // rnam par 'byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni /
translated: Spontaneous attention is that of those who have attained attention and who are in the four periods of time: the time of entering the actual basis of meditative concentration, the time of being in meditative equipoise, the time of realizing meditative equipoise, and the time of attaining or having attained arhatship.

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: Discriminating attention is that which is associated with insight.

original: nang du yang dag par sdud par byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang du yang dag par sdud par byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is inwardly collected is the side of serenity.

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed pa ni /🔽gang gis zag pa rnams spong zhing /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed pa ni / gang gis zag pa rnams spong zhing /
translated: That which is purified of obscurations🔽is that by which the defilements are abandoned

original: gnas ngan len yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
translated: and the negative reflex actions are destroyed.

original: rten grub pas spyod yul rnam par dag pa ni /🔽gang gis rten gyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas dmigs pa la spyod du zin kyang /
analyzed: rten grub pas spyod yul rnam par dag pa ni / gang gis rten gyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas dmigs pa la spyod du zin kyang /
translated: The sphere of activity is purified by the perfection of the support,🔽because, although one may be active in the objective sense-fields,

original: nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'o //🔽gzhan gyis byas pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽nyan thos rnams kyis gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'o // gzhan gyis byas pa ni 'di lta ste / nyan thos rnams kyis gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas /
translated: the defilements do not arise, since one is free from all negative reflex actions of the support.🔽That which is produced by another is that which arises from the correct mental attention of the disciples,

original: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'o //🔽so so rang gis rtogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'o // so so rang gis rtogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: in dependence on the words of another.🔽That which is individually attained is that which arises from the correct mental attention of the Solitary Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are fully enlightened without a teacher.🔽The mental attention of abundance is that of the Bodhisattvas,

original: rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because it is the mental attention of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang / de las byung ba shes pa rnams kyi byang chub tu smon lam 'debs par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang / de las byung ba shes pa rnams kyi byang chub tu smon lam 'debs par gtogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' aspiration for enlightenment is included in the knowledge of the faults of cyclic existence and of the means of transcending it.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The universal mental orientation is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The Buddhas, the Venerable Ones, have a knowledge that is not hidden anywhere,

original: sgrib pa med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum po rnams sam /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum po rnams sam /
translated: that is unobstructed, and that is perfectly endowed with the three vehicles of the bodhisattvas or

original: yang na rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams la mkhas par byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams la mkhas par byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: with the five branches of knowledge.

original: de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa ni chos la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa ni chos la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Among these, the mental orientation that discerns the characteristics is based on the teaching and on the meaning.

original: gzhan drug ni don la dmigs pa kho na'o //🔽lus @133a * //
analyzed: gzhan drug ni don la dmigs pa kho na'o // lus @133a * //
translated: The other six are based only on the meaning.

original: la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams ni bdun po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams ni bdun po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental orientations based on the body, etc. should be understood as included in all seven.

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu ni mos pa dang / de kho na yid la byed pas bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu ni mos pa dang / de kho na yid la byed pas bsdus so //
translated: The result of the culmination of application is included in the attention of conviction and the attention of reality.

original: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa ni mos pa'i yid la byed pa kho nas bsdus so //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa ni mos pa'i yid la byed pa kho nas bsdus so //
translated: The attention of investigation is included in the attention of conviction alone.

original: lhag ma gsum ni rnam grangs snga ma la brten te /
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni rnam grangs snga ma la brten te /
translated: The remaining three are included in the attention of reality, based on the former enumeration.

original: de kho na yid la byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa nyid do //
translated: The attention of reality is the attention of the learner alone.

original: gzhan rnams ni ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //

original: so sor bsten par bya ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor bsten par bya ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /

original: bying pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: bying pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /

translated: Not guarding the sense doors, not eating in moderation, not being diligent in the practice of the first and last parts of the night, not being aware, being deluded,

translated: They are the four beginning with not guarding the doors of the senses, as before, and being a person who engages in desire, a person who is not calm, a person whose mind is not wearied, a person who does not know the methods, and aspiration and so on that are as above, endowed with excessive tightness.

original: brtson pa la ma goms pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa la yongs su byang bar ma byas pa de'i phyogs gcig bsgom pa dang / nye du la rtog pa la sogs pa rgod pa dang mthun pa'i chos gang yang rung bas sems rnam par g-yengs pa'o //

translated: It is the cultivation of only one side of the path, for one who is not accustomed to striving and who has not purified his intense grasping. It is the distraction of the mind by any of the things that favor agitation, such as thoughts of relatives.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /

analyzed: thabs mi shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa la ma goms pa dang / dmigs pa la gtod par mi dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzis sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang rnam par g-yeng ba ma yin pa yongs su shes pa la mi gtod pa'o //

original: chags pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /

analyzed: gong du nges par 'byung ba la mi lta ba'o //

translated: the sign of affliction, the sign of non-affliction, the sign of correct application, the sign of incorrect application, the sign of appearance, the sign of discernment,

original: ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gnas pa'i mtshan ma dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gnas pa'i mtshan ma dang /
translated: the sign of excellent concentration, the sign of serenity, the sign of complete acceptance, the sign of insight, the sign of equanimity, the sign of concentration, the sign of remaining in concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i mtshan ma dang / skye ba'i mtshan ma dang / 'bral ba'i mtshan ma dang / thabs kyi mtshan ma dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i mtshan ma dang / skye ba'i mtshan ma dang / 'bral ba'i mtshan ma dang / thabs kyi mtshan ma dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: the sign of rising from concentration, the sign of birth, the sign of separation, the sign of means, and the sign of accomplishment.

original: de la rang gi sems kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang gi sems kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of one's own mind?

original: 'di la dge slong kun nas @135a * //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong kun nas @135a * //
translated: Here, a monk,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyi snga rol du /🔽'di ltar 'di lta bur sems kun nas nyon mongs so zhe'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyi snga rol du / 'di ltar 'di lta bur sems kun nas nyon mongs so zhe'am /
translated: before the mind is afflicted,🔽knows thus:🔽The mind is thus afflicted, or the mind is not afflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / sems bying ba la sogs pa'i thabs ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / sems bying ba la sogs pa'i thabs ni 'di yin no //
translated: The means for the mind that is slack, and so on, are as follows:

original: bying ba med pa la sogs ba bzhi'i thabs ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sems ma chags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bying ba med pa la sogs ba bzhi'i thabs ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sems ma chags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent the mind from being attached to the afflictions of the mind,

original: rang gi sems la legs par shin tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems la legs par shin tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: one should thoroughly and well apprehend the characteristics of one's own mind.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is an external characteristic?

original: 'di ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa la /
translated: When the mind becomes afflicted,

original: bdag gi sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur to snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur to snyam du rig nas /
translated: one should know that My mind has become afflicted.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstsal ba dang / kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstsal ba dang / kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate that affliction and prevent it from arising again,

original: 'di lta ste snang ba'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste snang ba'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: one should apprehend an external characteristic, such as

original: dang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dang bar bya ba'am /
translated: a bright appearance,

original: yang na gzhan gang yang rung ba'i phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gang yang rung ba'i phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or any other suitable external characteristic.

original: rten gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is a supporting characteristic?

original: lus su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po sa bon dang bcas pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i lus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po sa bon dang bcas pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i lus gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the body of discursive thought of all the five aggregates of the body with their seeds.

original: spyod yul gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: spyod yul gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of the domain?

original: gzugs nas chos la thug pa'i yul gang dang gang rnam par rtog pa'i lus yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas chos la thug pa'i yul gang dang gang rnam par rtog pa'i lus yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the object of discursive thought of any object from form to mental objects.

original: yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of mental attention?

original: de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yod na /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yod na /
translated: When there is mental attention,

original: yul de dang de la de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽bdag gi sems 'di ni yid la byed pa spyod yul la 'jug gi /
analyzed: yul de dang de la de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur te / bdag gi sems 'di ni yid la byed pa spyod yul la 'jug gi /
translated: then the consciousness of that object arises.🔽It is the sign of mental attention when one thinks: “My mind is engaged in mental attention and the domain,

original: yid la byed pa med par ni ma yin no snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par ni ma yin no snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: and not without mental attention.🔽”

original: sems bskyed pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of the arising of thought?

original: bshad ma thag pa gcig po de dang / gnyis pa 'du byed kyi rkyen dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis sems 'byung ngo snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa gcig po de dang / gnyis pa 'du byed kyi rkyen dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis sems 'byung ngo snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is the same as the one just explained. The second is the sign of the mental attention which thinks: “The condition of the formations and the condition of name-and-form are the cause of the arising of mind.”

original: gnas pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na / rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
translated: What is the sign of duration?🔽It is the sign of the mental attention which thinks: “The four abodes of consciousness are the cause of the arising of consciousness.”

original: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes mdo las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes mdo las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: As it is said in the Sutra: “Consciousness abides in dependence on name-and-form.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma gang @135b zhe na /🔽rang gi rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma gang @135b zhe na / rang gi rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: What is the sign of individualization?

original: so so rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mental attention which thinks: “The individual characteristics of the various families or the specific characteristics of each and every dharma.”

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽'du byed kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽'du byed kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: What is the sign of the general characteristics?🔽It is the sign of the mental attention which thinks: “The general characteristics of the formations are impermanence, suffering, the void and non-self.”

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid dam chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid dam chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sign of the general characteristics of the impure, or the sign of the general characteristics of all things.

original: rags pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rags pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of grossness?

original: sa 'og ma la rags par lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la rags par lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the contemplation of the grossness of the lower stage.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of calmness?

original: sa gong ma la zhi ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa gong ma la zhi ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the contemplation of the calmness of the higher stage.

original: myong ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of experience?

original: sngon myong ba'i 'du byed 'das pa rnams rjes su dran pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon myong ba'i 'du byed 'das pa rnams rjes su dran pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the recollection of past events.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of imagination?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the imagination of future events.

original: lhan cig 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of association?

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the contemplation of present events.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sign of defilement?

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so snyam du yid la byed pa nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so snyam du yid la byed pa nas /
translated: It is the sign of the mind associated with attachment, etc.

original: rgyas par sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: up to the sign of the mind that is not completely liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽de las zlog pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mtshan mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na / de las zlog pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mtshan mar rig par bya'o //
translated: What is a sign of non-defilement?🔽It is the opposite of the above.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa ni ;
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa ni ;
translated: The investigation of the mind associated with attachment, etc.

original: mngon par byung ba la spong ba la brtson par ma byas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mngon par byung ba la spong ba la brtson par ma byas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: is for those who have gone forth from the home life but who are not intent on the abandonment of defilements.🔽The investigation of the mind that is distracted, etc.

original: brtson pa rnams kyi ni bsdus pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa rnams kyi ni bsdus pa dang / zhum pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: is for those who are intent on the abandonment of defilements.🔽What is a mind associated with attachment?

original: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni /🔽'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni /🔽'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: It is a mind associated with attachment.

original: de'i phyogs gnas ngan len pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gnas ngan len pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the presence of the negative tendencies that are associated with it.

original: de bzhin du sems nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyang /
translated: In the same way, all the afflicted thoughts

original: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gnyis las ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gnyis las ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as being either entanglements or proclivities, as is appropriate.

original: yang na kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen por nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams rig @136a * //
analyzed: yang na kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen por nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams rig @136a * //
translated: Or, the non-afflicted thoughts should be understood as the antidotes to the entanglements and proclivities.

original: par bya'o // yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: par bya'o // yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sign of correct practice?

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi gzhi'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi gzhi'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mental attention to the sign of the basis of the bright side.

original: log par sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sign of incorrect practice?

original: nag po'i phyogs kyi gzhi'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs kyi gzhi'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mental attention to the sign of the basis of the dark side.

original: de bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsrungs par gnas pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo ma bsrungs par gnas pa nas /
translated: In the same way, the non-guarding of the sense-doors,

original: shes bzhin med par gnas pa'i bar du /
analyzed: shes bzhin med par gnas pa'i bar du /
translated: up to the absence of self-possession,🔽are signs of incorrect practice.

original: sems ni 'di lta bur kun nas nyon mongs pa can no snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni 'di lta bur kun nas nyon mongs pa can no snyam du yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mind that thinks, “The mind is defiled in this way.”

original: snang ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of light?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la las mun pa'i gnyen po'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la las mun pa'i gnyen po'am /
translated: It is the sign of the antidote to darkness.

original: chos kyi snang ba las legs par shin tu mtshan mar rab tu bzung zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba las legs par shin tu mtshan mar rab tu bzung zhing /
translated: It is the sign of the light of the Dharma that is well and truly grasped,

original: legs par yid la byas te /
analyzed: legs par yid la byas te /
translated: well and truly taken to mind,

original: 'og ji lta ba bzhin du steng yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mun pa'i mtshan ma'i gnyen por 'di gzhag go //
analyzed: 'og ji lta ba bzhin du steng yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mun pa'i mtshan ma'i gnyen por 'di gzhag go //
translated: and well and truly realized, as in the case of the light of the sun, the moon, a fire, a gem, a lamp, or the light of the stars.

original: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of investigation?

original: 'di la dge slong gis so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma nyid legs par shin tu rab tu mtshan mar bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong gis so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma nyid legs par shin tu rab tu mtshan mar bzung ba yin te /
translated: It is the sign of the investigation of the monk who has well and truly grasped the sign of investigation.

original: dper na / 'greng bas 'dug pa la so sor rtog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / 'greng bas 'dug pa la so sor rtog pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, it is like the investigation of a seated person by a standing person.

original: da ltar gyi 'dzin pas ma 'ongs pa'i gzung ba'i chos la so sor rtog pa dang / 'dug pas nyal ba la rtog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'dzin pas ma 'ongs pa'i gzung ba'i chos la so sor rtog pa dang / 'dug pas nyal ba la rtog pa bzhin du /
translated: The present subject of consciousness discriminates the future object of consciousness, just as one who is sitting discriminates one who is lying down.

original: da ltar gyi 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i gzung ba'i chos la rtog pa dang / mdun du 'gro ba la phyi nas 'ong bas so sor rtog pa bzhin du 'dzin pa phyi ma phyi mas 'dzin pa'i chos snga ma snga ma la so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i gzung ba'i chos la rtog pa dang / mdun du 'gro ba la phyi nas 'ong bas so sor rtog pa bzhin du 'dzin pa phyi ma phyi mas 'dzin pa'i chos snga ma snga ma la so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: The present subject of consciousness discriminates the past object of consciousness, just as one who is going in front discriminates one who is coming behind.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i chos so sor brtag pa las rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i chos so sor brtag pa las rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: the sign of the object of consciousness is taught as twofold: the sign of the object of consciousness that is the internal sense spheres and the sign of the object of consciousness that is the external sense spheres.

original: ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of good meditative concentration?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mental orientation to the repulsive, such as a bloated corpse, which acts as the counteragent to the passion of sensuality.

original: ci'i phyir de la bzang po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la bzang po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “good”?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo ni 'dod chags yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo ni 'dod chags yin te /
translated: Because passion is the principal element in all the moral defilements.

original: 'dod chags thams cad kyi nang na yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni thams cad kyis legs par gzhom bar dka' ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad kyi nang na yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni thams cad kyis legs par gzhom bar dka' ba yin la /
translated: Among all the attachments, attachment to the objects of desire is the most difficult to overcome.

original: de ni de'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir bzang po zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de ni de'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir bzang po zhes bya'o//
translated: Since this is the object of the antidote to that attachment, it is called the excellent sign.

original: @136b zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: @136b zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of calm?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yid la byed pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the sign of the mental orientation to the non-conceptual image.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽dang bar bya ba'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba'am /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na / dang bar bya ba'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba'am /
translated: What is the sign of control?
