original: res 'ga' ni rtog pa'i stong pa nyid kyis nang dang phyi stong pa nyid yid la byed de de'i dbang gis de gnyis la sems 'jug go //🔽gal te nang dang phyi stong pa nyid la yang mi 'jug na ni /🔽de'i 'og tu mi g-yo ba yid la byed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rtog pa'i stong pa nyid kyis nang dang phyi stong pa nyid yid la byed de de'i dbang gis de gnyis la sems 'jug go // gal te nang dang phyi stong pa nyid la yang mi 'jug na ni / de'i 'og tu mi g-yo ba yid la byed de /
translated: Sometimes, by the emptiness of conceptualization, he attends to internal and external emptiness, and by the power of that, his mind enters into those two.🔽If he does not enter into internal and external emptiness,🔽then after that he attends to the unshakable.🔽🔽

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sam /🔽sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes la bya'o //🔽de de ltar yid la byas pas nga'o snyam du g-yo bar mi 'gyur te 'di'o //🔽bdag go // nga'o snyam du rgya cher de'i sems g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na de gnyis la de'i sems 'jug go //🔽smon pa med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽nya bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la /🔽mi rtag pa'am sdug bsngal bar yid la byed cing /🔽sems kyi gnas pa rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sam /🔽sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes la bya'o //🔽de de ltar yid la byas pas nga'o snyam du g-yo bar mi 'gyur te 'di'o //🔽bdag go // nga'o snyam du rgya cher de'i sems g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na de gnyis la de'i sems 'jug go //🔽smon pa med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽nya bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la /🔽mi rtag pa'am sdug bsngal bar yid la byed cing /🔽sems kyi gnas pa rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la 'gog pa dang zhi bar yid la byed cing sems kyi gnas pa rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la 'gog pa dang zhi bar yid la byed cing sems kyi gnas pa rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is the concentration on the wishless?🔽It is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the cessation and the calm of the five aggregates of attachment, and which is associated with the idea of the three forms of wishlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /🔽'dud @143a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni / 'dud @143a * //
translated: The concentration on the wishless is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the cessation and the calm of the five aggregates of attachment, and which is associated with the idea of the three forms of wishlessness.🔽The concentration on the signless is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the cessation and the calm of the five aggregates of attachment, and which is associated with the idea of the three forms of signlessness.🔽What is the concentration on the wishless?🔽It is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the cessation and the calm of the five aggregates of attachment, and which is associated with the idea of the three forms of wishlessness.

original: par yang mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la ji ltar 'dud par mi byed cing mngon par 'dud par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: par yang mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la ji ltar 'dud par mi byed cing mngon par 'dud par mi byed ce na /
translated: What are the three forms of wishlessness?

original: mi mthun pa dang mthun pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang mthun pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the wishlessness of the realm of desire, the wishlessness of the realm of form, and the wishlessness of the formless realm.🔽What is the concentration on the signless?🔽It is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the cessation and the calm of the five aggregates of attachment, and which is associated with the idea of the three forms of signlessness.🔽What are the three forms of signlessness?

original: yang na mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: They are the signlessness of the realm of desire, the signlessness of the realm of form, and the signlessness of the formless realm.🔽What is the concentration on emptiness?

original: de la mtshan ma rnams yid la mi byed pas ni de dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma rnams yid la mi byed pas ni de dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is the one-pointedness of thought which takes as its object the emptiness of the five aggregates of attachment.

original: sun mi 'byin par mngon par 'du mi byed pa kho nar byed de /
analyzed: sun mi 'byin par mngon par 'du mi byed pa kho nar byed de /
translated: He does not react to them, but simply does not engage in them.

original: de bas na 'dud par mi byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dud par mi byed ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he does not bow down to them.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pas ni /
translated: By attending to the sphere of signlessness,

original: de la chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he does not become attached to them.

original: de bas na mngon par 'dud par mi byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par 'dud par mi byed ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he does not bow down to them.

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This concentration is of two kinds:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dang / sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dang / sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: that which arises from practice and that which is the result of practice.

original: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog par byed pa mtshan ma rnams las kyang rnam par ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog par byed pa mtshan ma rnams las kyang rnam par ma grol ba ste /
translated: Of these, that which arises from practice is the placement of the mind through analysis and investigation, but it is not yet free from signs.

original: 'di ltar de'i rnam par shes pa mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas skabs skabs su sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rnam par shes pa mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas skabs skabs su sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug go //
translated: Thus, his consciousness follows after signs, and from time to time the mind becomes entangled.

original: de yang so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog pa na /
analyzed: de yang so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog pa na /
translated: But when he places the mind through analysis and investigation,

original: 'bras bu med par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par byed de /
translated: he does not allow it to be fruitless.

original: mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba las kyang grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang ba las kyang grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is also liberated from following signs.

original: rnam par grol ba de yang rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de yang rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that liberation is also liberated because of liberation.

original: so sor brtags nas gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not liberated by being fixed after examination.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is well liberated.

original: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog pa na yang gnas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags shing 'jog pa na yang gnas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin gyi /
translated: He is liberated because he is fixed after examination and examination.

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But he is not well liberated.

original: kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fruit of complete knowledge and the benefit of complete knowledge are

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the accomplishment of the abandonment of defilements and the happy abiding in this life.

original: yang 'gog pa dang / lam yang kun nas shes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa dang / lam yang kun nas shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, cessation and the path are complete knowledge.

original: de gnyis ni kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those two should be connected with the fruit of complete knowledge and the benefit of complete knowledge, respectively.

original: yang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang kun shes pa yin la /
analyzed: yang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang kun shes pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the realization of the truths is complete knowledge.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang kun shes pa yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang kun shes pa yin te /
translated: The state of an arhat is also the state of complete knowledge.

original: de la mthong @143b ba'i lam gyi tshe ni kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la mthong @143b ba'i lam gyi tshe ni kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: At the time of the path of seeing, it is the result of complete knowledge.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i tshe ni kun shes pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i tshe ni kun shes pa'i phan yon no //
translated: At the time of the result of an arhat, it is the benefit of complete knowledge.

original: gang la gang med par de des stong par mthong bas na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la gang med par de des stong par mthong bas na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since one sees that whatever is absent in something is empty of that, it is called emptiness.

original: de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which sees in that way

original: de nyid la smon par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: de nyid la smon par mi byed pas na /
translated: does not aspire to that,

original: smon pa med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: smon pa med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: so it is called wishless.

original: /'du byed thams cad mtshan ma med par mthong bas na mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan las ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: /'du byed thams cad mtshan ma med par mthong bas na mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o // gzhan las ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Since one sees all formations as signless, it is called signless.

original: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'o zhes stong pa nyid mjug tu smos na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'o zhes stong pa nyid mjug tu smos na /
translated: In other sources, impermanence is said to be suffering and suffering is said to be identityless, with emptiness mentioned last.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir stong pa nyid sngar bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir stong pa nyid sngar bstan ce na /
translated: Why is emptiness taught first here?

original: ji srid du bdag med pa'i 'du shes la yang dag par mi gnas pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du bdag med pa'i 'du shes la yang dag par mi gnas pa de srid du /
translated: As long as one does not correctly abide in the discernment of identitylessness,

original: gang gis smon pa med par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba mthong ba de ltar yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis smon pa med par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba mthong ba de ltar yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not completely purified in the way that impermanence and suffering are seen, which lead to the absence of wishes.

original: de'i 'og tu smon pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smon pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after that, there is the absence of wishes.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes can du gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes can du gyur na /
translated: Therefore, when one has the perception of impermanence,

original: bdag med pa'i 'du shes la yang dag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i 'du shes la yang dag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: one becomes established in the perception of nonself.

original: des mi rtag pa de bdag med par mthong na /
analyzed: des mi rtag pa de bdag med par mthong na /
translated: When one sees that impermanence as nonself,

original: smon par mi byed de /
analyzed: smon par mi byed de /
translated: one does not wish for it.

original: nges par 'byung ba tshol ba ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba tshol ba ni /
translated: One who seeks deliverance

original: smon pa med pa nyid la smon par byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa nyid la smon par byed do //
translated: wishes for the absence of wishes.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu mtshan ma med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu mtshan ma med pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, after that, the absence of signs is taught.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration with applied thought and sustained thought?

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ka mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ka mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is associated with both applied thought and sustained thought.
